loans.name: Jina

texts.en:
Fishing is the most common livelihood for people in Concepcion, Iloilo. Jina is from this place and she is doing the same thing for an income. For the last 15 years, this has been her livelihood. She is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets and fishing weights. This will enable her to fish with ease together with her husband.

Jina is 44 years old, with two grown children and in the future she hopes to have another fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and fishing weights

loans.name: Nadgie

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Nadgie works hard to support her family.

She has a hollow-block making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and a cafeteria business. Nadgie is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy sand and cement for her hollow block making business.

Nadgie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement for hollow block making.

loans.name: Mamani

texts.en:
Mamani hails from Dhupguri. She is a 28-year-old married woman blessed with three daughters. Two of her daughters are reading in class three and two and another one is too small to go to school. She is a very strong and energetic woman. She is involved in the livestock business.

Mamani’s husband Manik is a 40-year-old farmer. His income is hardly sufficient for his family. So Mamani decided to purchase a dairy cow to supply milk and dairy products to her neighbors in her locality to generate more income. Thus, she is taking a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). 
  
With the increased income and savings, Mamani will be able to fulfill her dreams, which include constructing a new and better house and providing further education to her children.

She appreciates the financial help of her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to supply milk and dairy products in her locality.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina is requesting a loan of $700 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional supplies to keep in her store, including sugar, salt, perfume, detergent, shampoo, candles, teas and other things to sell. She has been doing business since 2012 with her own working capital of $150. She wants to open a big store in the future so she is taking this loan to have good management to improve her business. She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods. Marcelina also has animals like cows, pigs and chickens.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, perfume, detergent, shampoo, candles, teas and other things to sell.

loans.name: Munkhtur

texts.en: Mrs. Munkhtur, 42 years old, lives with her husband and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her husband have been running an automobile repair shop for 18 years. Their children study at university. The garage they operate has deteriorated over the years and needs some updates. She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy fiberglass, vacuum-insulated windows and install a new heating system, as the previous one is considered hazardous. By doing so, the renovated garage will prevent the cars from freezing and preserve the quality of the cars until the owners get back. Cars which are repaired well tend to emit less smoke and waste less fuel. In the profile picture, the borrower is with her husband who is a renowned repairman in the capital city.

loans.use: to renovate the garage and install a heating system

loans.name: Nansalmaa

texts.en: Nansalmaa used her previous loan for renovating her house; now she and her husband live in comfortable and warm place. Most importantly they have reduced their coal usage for heating and saved money on coal purchases. Now she is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy clothes, such as lingerie, shirts and trousers. She wants to increase the diversity of her goods in order to meet customer demands. If successful, she and her husband's living standard will improve greatly.

loans.use: to increase the diversity of her goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, brick, sand, iron and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk that she can sell.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia hails from the municipality of Concepcion, Iloilo. She is married to a fisherman and has learned fishing as her livelihood to help raise seven children, who are aged 7-18. She is asking for a loan for additional capital to buy crab traps and pay for the labor of men who will help fish. She hopes that this will further expand her business which has been thriving for the last 18 years, except for the calamity that hit her place last year.

Her income will provide food and school fees for her children. In the future, Olivia plans to make her fishing business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy crab traps and pay for the labor of men who will help fish

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
Suzette is a 41-year-old married woman with a three-year-old son. She and her husband work hard for the future of their child. She raises hogs while her husband fishes for a living. This has been their source of income for ten years now. 

Suzette is asking for a loan to buy piglets and fishing nets. Suzette always thinks of ways to expand her business. Her income will be for her family's healthy diet and savings.

In the future, she hopes to buy more piglets to raise and a new fishing boat for her husband.

loans.use: to buy piglets and fishing nets

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 29 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming bananas in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jocelyn has been farming bananas for two years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 57 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Emily runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Emily would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy is 27 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Cristy runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, rice and other groceries. 

In the future Cristy would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: eggs, rice, chicken, meat, tomatoes, fish, etc.

loans.name: Rose Ann

texts.en:
Rose Ann is 34 years old. She is married with three young children ages 1, 8 and 10. Her husband is a fisherman. And for the last six years fishing has been her livelihood too. She is asking for a loan of 15000 PHP to buy an engine and a fishing net. Its a relief for Rose Ann that she can request a loan and looks forward to its impact on their business. 

In the future, she hope to have another fishing boat and to buy more sturdy and new fishing nets to expand her business. 

Her income will be used for food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy an engine and a fishing net.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is married and she works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Rebecca is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Chino

texts.en:
China is 26 years old and is from Concepcion, Iloilo. Living in Concepcion is quite a challenge due to his limited source of income. The town is far from the mainland, and for people to reach Concepcion, they have to ride a boat. Most people here are fishermen.

Chino is also involved in the fishing business. In addition, he works as a baker in his small bakery. Chino works hard to provide for his children, who are 4 and 6 years old.

He is asking for a loan to buy flour, sugar, margarine, lard and fishing nets. The loan proceeds will allow him to buy these products in bulk and to produce more bread for better profits. Chino dreams of sending his children to school in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and necessities (e.g., flour, sugar, margarine, lard and fishing nets)

loans.name: Paulita

texts.en:
Paulita is a Sari-sari (variety) store owner from the town of Baybay, Leyte. She is married with five grown children. Her husband work as a carpenter. 

She has been engaged in the business of selling basic household commodities for 12 years now. She is asking for a loan to buy rice, noodles, soy sauce, canned goods, soft drinks, vinegar, and toiletries.

With her profit, Paulita dreams of saving for her future needs as well as making expansion someday to ensure better profitability.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, soy sauce, canned goods, soft drinks, vinegar, and toiletries

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 39 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marissa has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Marissa has been in this business for two years. In the future, Marissa would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela is 59 years old and is married with eight children, one of whom is in school.

Marcela works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She explains that she has been running the general store for twelve years but also earns additional income from a cafeteria.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 8,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Notably, Marcela has borrowed and successfully repaid three prior loans from NWTF. Marcela aspires to build and expand her business to secure a better future of her family.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing additional groceries

loans.name: Annie Rose

texts.en:
Annie Rose is 34 years old. She is married and has three children. Her children are 3, 9 and 13 years old.

For 15 years now, she has operated a sari-sari (variety) store business in Concepcion, Iloilo. She runs her store while her husband fishes for income.

She is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets and merchandise such as cooking oil, spices, toothpaste, milk, coffee and toiletries. She believes that the loan proceeds will help to boost her income because she always runs out of items to sell. With the additional capital, she can buy her stocks in bulk and increase her profits. In addition, she plans on using a portion of the loan proceeds to replace her husband's worn fishing nets. Annie Rose is determined to make her business successful and hopes to have another fishing boat in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise (e.g., cooking oil, spices, toothpaste, milk, coffee and toiletries) and fishing nets

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: Safia is 28 years of age. She is a housewife and looks after her family consisting of five persons. She is well trained in cloth stitching. She provides the services of stitching to the people at her own house. She needed to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials for the business, including threads, needles, cloth etc. This was very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money, she found it difficult to do so. So, Safia requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. BRAC Pakistan issued her loan as she requested. Safia is very thankful to Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her stitching work

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es: Angélica de 27 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos de 7 y 4 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que no se deja vencer por las adversidades, por lo que ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos como madre soltera, apoyada solamente en su negocio de fabricación y venta de artesanías, desde hace 9 años, además vende helados en su domicilio. En la vivienda de Angélica el cuarto de la cocina se encuentra deteriorado por lo que ella desea construir el techo y el piso y así tener mejores condiciones habitacionales, pero no cuenta con la liquidez necesaria, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, polines, cemento, arena y grava para cambiar el techo y encementar el piso del cuarto de la cocina.
texts.en:
Angelica, aged 27, lives in her own house with her two children, aged seven and four.

She is a woman who doesn't give up in the face of adversity. For this reason, she has been able to get her children ahead as a single mother. Her only support comes from her business, which is making and selling handicrafts—an occupation that she has been following for nine years now. In addition, she sells ice cream at her home.

At Angelica's house, the room where the kitchen is located is deteriorated. For this reason, she wants to rebuild the roof and the floor. In this way, she could have better living conditions. However, she doesn't have the money needed to do so. This is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI. She will use the loan to purchase galvanized metal sheeting, purlins, cement, sand, and gravel to replace the roof on and install concrete flooring in her kitchen.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized metal sheeting, purlins, cement, sand, and gravel to replace the roof on and install concrete flooring in her kitchen.

loans.name: Ngạn

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngạn is 60 years old and is married with 6 children. She lives with 2 dependents in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Ngạn works in the agriculture business: farming, poultry, and cattle. Ngạn has been involved in this business for 8 years.

This would be Ngạn's first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. One of her main business challenges is ensuring that her farm's latrine is hygienic. As a result, she is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick in order to build a toilet. In the future, she hopes for an increase in her business's profits, for her business to prosper, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to build a toilet by purchasing sand, cement and brick

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 43 years old and married with five children.

Jonalyn is in the agricultural business, farming rice and vegetables in the Philippines. Jonalyn requested a PHP 60,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jonalyn has been farming rice for five years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain the business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is the age of 45 and a mother of four children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer by profession, and he has been selling fresh fruits at a shop in a nearby town for the last 10 years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh fruits to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this fruit shop.
 
Now, the needs of his family have suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize his sales from the fruits. So, Razia demanded a loan so that her husband would be able to buy more fruit to sell.

Razia is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits for her husband's fruit selling business

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a married, 38-year-old woman. She and her husband have four children, three of whom are in school.

She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lolita has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Lolita has been in this business for three years.

Lolita is requesting a loan in the amount of 8,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy additional fish to sell to her customers. In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing additional fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is 25 years old and single. She is engaged in cooking and selling snack foods within the local community to generate income. She has been roaming around the village selling taho (a snack food) for almost six years. She aims to continue her business and prepare more snack recipes to sell. Having inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy sugar, sago, plastic cups and other ingredients she needs to cook and sell. Being patient and industrious, she believes that she will be able to make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy sugar, sago, plastic cups and other ingredients

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 63 years old and a widow with seven children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Milagros runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more goods to sell.

She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, shampoo, sardines and other groceries. 

In the future, Milagros would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra belongs to Lahore. She is married and a hardworking housewife. 

Her husband has a scrap business where he collects different kinds of scrap and then resells it to recycled product manufacturers. He is hardworking and loyal. He is the sole earning person in the family and tries to meet all the household expenses. He wants to buy more scrap such as broken appliances and waste paper, etc., to resell and generate profits. 

Bushra has therefore requested a loan through BRAC Pakistan to help her husband buy scrap materials and sell them at profit. They are thankful to Kiva and are hopeful for a better future.

loans.use: To buy scrap goods such as broken  appliances, waste paper, etc., for reselling to the recycling factories.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen is the age of 48; she is mother of three children and living in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. 

He manages his household necessities from his own store as well. Some of his relatives like to purchase from his general store. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relation with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town; that is the reason his business running well. 

Due to good relations, his sales have increased a lot but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Parveen requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etc. Parveen thanks  Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's general store business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her son's tailoring work

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in Masindi, Uganda. She is a hardworking woman and runs a beauty salon. She built rentals to supplement her income. Grace started her business to take care of her family's needs. She desires to educate her children and expand her salon.

Inadequate capital hinders her business.

She needs a loan to buy a generator for her salon.

loans.use: to buy a generator for her salon.

loans.name: Dana Kerti Group

texts.en:
After passing several loan periods, it can be inferred that the Dana Kerti Group has managed to boost the income for their families. It can be seen from the level of sales and livestock populations that are maintained.

Desak Gede has even been able to increase the population of her pigs. Desak Gede is very grateful for all that she has from her business and her family. She said she is very happy over the situation now, and she still needs a new loan to further improve her business again.

Dana Kerti Group is located in the western part of Bali. The husbands of the members of the group work as farmers. As Balinese woman, they also support their husbands’ incomes by raising pigs at home.

In order to further enhance the earnings in the field of breeding pigs, Desak Gede and the whole group of Dana Kerti continue borrowing from MUK the same amount. They are very satisfied with the services provided, so they agreed to develop this business. 

Now Desak Gede will use the loan to buy three super-quality piglets. She still expects the assistance of MUK for business consulting. The profits will be saved for future needs.

loans.use: to buy three super-quality piglets.

loans.name: Silvina

texts.en: Silvina lives in Suai and her business is billiard games. She lives near many people, so she had the idea of opening billiard games for everybody. She is earning a good income every day because many people like to play this game, so she is very happy with her business. Now she is applying for a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She started having billiard games in 2013 with her own working capital of $400. She is taking this loan because she wants to buy cards, chalk sticks, powder, balls, carpet and other materials. She hopes with this loan her business can improve in the future.

loans.use: to buy cards, chalk sticks, powder, balls, carpet and other materials.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a hardworking woman who operates a bar and retail shop in a trading centre ten kilometres from Lyantonde town. The money from the business, along with the help of her husband, helped them to build a residential house for the family. 

Betty is now asking for a loan to complete the house. She will use the income from the business to pay the loan. She thanks the Kiva lenders for the support.

loans.use: To buy cement, shutters and paint

loans.name: Limousine Group

texts.en:
Lister, who is in his mid 40s, is married with four children, two of whom are still in school and two of whom are still small. He has been running a butcher shop since 1999. He works from 5:30 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Lister's 14th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to keep increasing his stock of meat and has successfully paid back all his loans. He is doing great and appreciates Kiva for the support. He used the profits to pay school fees, bought a plot of land, bought a TV set, a deck, built his own house and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to buy more meat for his butcher shop. He dreams of selling fish in his butcher shop.

Lister will share this loan with his loan group "Limousine" which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more meat for his butcher shop.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru:
Мавчуде 51 год. Она продавщица из южного района Пяндж и занимается там собственным маленьким торговым бизнесом. Ее торговая точка расположена на рынке. Мавчуда в основном продает овощи, салаты и бобовые продукты. Этим бизнесом она занимается каждый день без выходных на протяжении 9 лет.
Мавчуда мать-одиночка. У нее единственный сын, которому 23 года и он работает в Министерстве внутренних дел. Он для Мавчуды гордость и опора в жизни. 
Мавчуда сейчас намерена расширить торговлю. Для этого она нуждается в заемных средствах и поэтому обратилась за кредитом для купли партии овощей. Кредит поможет ей увеличить ассортимент товара и соответственно увеличить доход от бизнеса. Она нуждается в вашей поддержке.
texts.en:
Mavjuda is 51 years old.  She is a market vendor from the southern district of Pyandj in Tajikistan, and she has her own small retail business.  Her retail outlet is located at the market.  Mavjuda mostly sells vegetables, salads and bean products.  She has been working seven days a week, without a break, for the past nine years.

Mavjuda is a single mother.  She has a 23-year-old son who works for the Ministry of the Interior.  Mavjuda is extremely proud of her son and he is her support in life.

Mavjuda would like to increase her business.  To do so, she needs to borrow money, so she is taking a loan to buy an assortment of vegetables.  This loan will help her to increase her inventory and consequently the income she makes from her business.  She needs your support.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Meshac

texts.en: Meshac is a hardworking man who needs a loan to buy more cattle. He lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is married with two children. He raises cattle to generate income through milk products and cattle sales. He started a primary school to supplement his income. He desires to have over 50 head of cattle but weather vagaries and diseases affect his cattle.

loans.use: to buy more cattle

loans.name: Putri Sari Group

texts.en:
All the member of the Putri Sari group earned a satisfactory profit. Now they can make a saving and also increase the number of pigs in their cages. The group now proposes a loan for farming. Beside being pig breeders, they also have small land for farming. They plan to plant paddy this season. 

Ni Putu will use her loan to purchase paddy seeds and fertilizer and to rent a tractor. All of this work is helped by her husband and her child after he comes from school. Ni Putu has 40 acres of rice field. She thanks for the support she had and she hopes her farming business goes well and she can earn enough profit.

Ni Made, as the head of Putri Sari group, can’t attend the meeting to make the payment because of sickness. The payment is being handled by the treasurer, Ni Putu. Ni Putu is a housewife with a15 year old child. Her husband works as a mason. Now Ni Putu is pregnant and will have a baby soon. Her pigs business gives her a satisfactory profit and she will use it for the baby. She sold eight piglets for 500,000 IDR each.

loans.use: to purchase paddy seeds and fertilizer and to rent a tractor

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Fe works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising livestock.  Fe is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall.

Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Rufino

texts.es:
Rufino de 69 años de edad,  es agricultor de 69 años de edad,  estudio hasta segundo grado de educación básica, es padre de 6 hijos, ella es costurera desde muy joven. Ellos viven en su casa propia. 

Rufino es agricultor, trabajo que aprendió desde muy pequeño ya que fue su padre que le enseño. De igual forma, él ha heredado esta gran enseñanza a sus hijos, su esposa trabaja como costurera ayudándole con los gastos del hogar; de igual forma cuentan con el apoyo de sus hijos, pero él cómo un hombre independiente siempre le ha gustado tener sus propios ingresos.

El lugar donde cultiva se encuentra a una distancia de 25 minutos desde su casa. Su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 am a 12:00 pm.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar herbicidas y fertilizantes para su cultivo de maíz.  Cuando realice la recolección de los granos, ya hacer frente a la responsabilidad crediticia adquirida.


Sus planes son mejorar su producción de maíz, mejorar su vivienda y garantizar la seguridad alimentaria para su familia.
texts.en:
Rufino 69, is a 69 year old farmer. He studied up to second grade. He has 6 children. 

She has been a seamstress since a young age. The live in their own home. 

Rufino is a farmer, a trade he learned when he was very young as his father taught him. Similarly,  he has inherited the ability to teach the skills to his children. HIs wife works as a seamstress helping with the household costs. He also depends on the support from his children, but as he is an independent man he has always liked having his own income. 

The place where he farms is located 25 minutes from his house. He works from 6am to 12pm

He is requesting a loan to buy herbicides and fertilizers for his maize crops. 

His plans are to improve is maize production, improve his house and guarantee food security for his family.

loans.use: o buy herbicides and fertilizers for his maize crops.

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.en:
Carmelina is 51 years old and married with six children.

Carmelina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Carmelina has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years. She also earns an income from food vending.

Carmelina aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Kher Ul Nisa

texts.en:
Kher ul Nisa is the age of 48; she is the mother of four children and living in Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her son has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store as well. Some of his relatives like to purchase from his general store. 

He speaks with a very even tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relation with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town; that is the reason his business running well. 

Due to good relations, his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Kher ul Nisa requested a loan for her son so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etc. Kher ul Nisa thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her son's general store business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To rent a space at the fair and start a cooking and selling business.

loans.name: Huma

texts.en:
Huma, age 31, is a responsible mother of two children living happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. This is her first loan with BRAC and Kiva. Her husband owns a scrap shop and deals with scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles etc. He has been purchasing scrap goods from the common people and selling them to the recycling factories. Now, due to household expenses, he does not have money to buy scrap goods and does not have scrap to sell to get money.

Therefore, Huma requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents. 

She is very impressed with this honorable support and shows her wish to take more loans after the repayment of this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's scrap business

loans.name: Chuluuntsetseg

texts.en:
Chuluuntsetseg has used her previous loan for paying the remaining payment of her electric car. She has been working as a train attendant for many years and her husband works at a mining company. 

This time, she is requesting  a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to start a new business of nut sales in order to improve her family's living standard. In the profile picture, the borrower is with her husband.

loans.use: to start a new business of nut sales

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es: Mario de 29 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que pone todo su esmero para sacar adelante a su compañera de vida y a sus 2 hijos una niña de 2 años y un varón de 9 años de edad. Él es un hombre responsable que se gana la vida con su taller de mecánica en el que realizan trabajos de: mecánica automotriz, mecánica de obra de banco y enderezado y pintura, y cuenta con este negocio desde hace 5 años y está ubicado en su vivienda. Mario desea repellar las paredes de su vivienda y cambiar las láminas del techo de la misma, y es para ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, cemento y arena para repellar las paredes y cambiar las láminas del techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mario, 29, is a hard working man who puts all his efforts into improving life for his life partner and his two children, a 2 year old girl and a 9 year old boy. 

He is a responsible man who earns a living with his mechanics garage where he performs work such as: car repairs and bodyshop repairs. 

He has had this business for five years and it is located in his house. 

Mario wants to plaster the walls in his home and change the sheets on the roof. 

He is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: galvanized steel, cement and sand to plaster the walls and change the sheets on the roof of his house.

loans.use: to invest in: galvanized steel, cement and sand to plaster the walls and change the sheets on the roof of his house.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 33 years old and has three children who are in school.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Laila requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

Laila has been in this business for two years.  In the future,  she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela, age 39, is a mother of three children. Her husband owns a tailoring shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. 

He needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of tailoring materials for the shop, including threads, needles, cloth, etc. This is very important for him to continue his work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult. 

Therefore his wife, Shakeela, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. He will purchase the needful things with the help of the loan. 

Shakeela is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kava lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her husband's tailoring work

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees is the age of 40; she is the mother of four children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a house wife and looks after her family at home. 

Her husband works in dairy products, like milk, curd, and butter, for sale. He owns a small dairy farm that consists of buffaloes and cows. He daily sells milk to different tea stalls. He is an honest man. He manages his household necessities from his earning from milk sale.  

He speaks with an even tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of his clients. He was in need of one buffalo to increase his income through the milk sale business, so Balqees requested a loan. In this way she can support her husband's business.

She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's milk sale business

loans.name: Sapia

texts.ru: Сапия, 59 лет, замужем, есть сын, муж и сын помогают по бизнесу. У Сапии - среднее образование. С 2004 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, выращивая кукурузу на 0,24 ГА собственной земли. Благодаря упорному труду Сапии, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 3 коровы. Совокупный ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сапия обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Sapia is 59 years old, married, and the mother of one son.  Her husband and her son help her with her small business.  Sapia has the equivalent of a high school education.  Since 2004, she has been involved in animal husbandry and agriculture, growing corn on 0.24 hectare of her own land.  Thanks to her very hard work, she now owns three cows.  She makes a total monthly income of 12,000 som (KGS).  In order to further grow her farming business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy cows.  She plans to re-invest the earnings from this loan into further expanding her herd.

loans.use: to purchase additional cattle for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Natalia Veralicia

texts.es: Natalia de 30 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su hija de 8 años de edad desde hace 2 años. Ella es una mujer que se esfuerza por dar lo mejor a su pequeña hija, por lo que desde hace mucho tiempo se gana la vida como cocinera en un restaurante cercano, lo que le ha permitido sostener la economía de su hogar. Natalia adquirió un crédito con la institución anteriormente el cual utilizo para reparar el techo de su vivienda, por lo que se siente muy agradecida, pero el crédito no alcanzo para terminar la reparación, por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, pines y mano de obra necesaria para continuar con la reparación del techo de su vivienda..
texts.en:
Natalia is 30 years old. For the past two years she has lived in her own home with her 8 year old daughter. 

She is a woman who strives to provide the best for her daughter. For a long time she has worked as a cook at a close by restaurant. 

This has allowed her to support the household economy. 

Natalia has received a previous loan from the institution which she used to repair the roof of her home. She is very grateful for this but the loan was not enough to finish the repairs.
 
Therefore she is requesting a new loan from FUSAI to invest in: galvanized sheets, pins, and labor to continue with the roof reparations of her home.

loans.use: to invest in: galvanized sheets, pins, and labor to continue with the roof reparations of her home.

loans.name: Imelda De La Paz

texts.es: Imelda de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, ella se dedica desde hace 3 años a la venta de antojitos (papas, yuca, platanitos fritos, etc.) con las ventas que realiza logra cubrir algunos gastos del hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo la pared y cambiar el techo en el lugar que muestra la fotografía pero con lo que gana no le alcanza por esa razón solicitando nuevamente un crédito pero esta vez es para comprar cemento, ladrillos, polines, laminas, hierro, arena y pago de mano de obra y asi poder vivir ella y su familia mas seguros y cómodos.
texts.en:
Imelda, 32, lives in her own home with her husband and four children. 

For the past three years she has sold snacks (chips, yuca, fried plantains etc.). She is able to cover the household expenses with her sales. 

She wants to improve her house by constructing a wall and replacing the roof as shown in the photo. However she does not earn enough to cover these costs. 

Therefore,  she is requesting a loan to buy cement, bricks, studs, plates, iron, sand and pay for labor. This way her and her family can live more comfortably and safely.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, studs, plates, iron, sand and pay for labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stone, cement, sand, gravel, and rebar to build a retaining wall in the back of her home.

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Being a responsible mother, Juditha has been engaged in direct selling of Avon, Natasha and MSE products within her community to generate additional income. She is 38 years old and has three children in school. She aims to continue to improve her business to increase her income. 

Having inadequate capital, Juditha would like to take out a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos to buy more stock to sell in the local community. Being a kind and friendly mother, she hopes that she will further improve the business and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy more stock of Avon, Natasha and MSE products to resell

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis es un Joven estudiante de Informática, actualmente esta cursando el tercer año, estudia en horario de la noche porque esta trabajando por la mañana y por las tardes hace practica de su carrera. Su Madre esta trabajando en España y el esta con su Padre quien trabaja también como empleado, para mas adelante cuando termine sus estudios piensa Emprender un Negocio de Ventas de Computadora, Reparación e Instalación de Programas Informáticos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar su matriculación, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando, luchando por cumplir su sueño.
texts.en:
Luis is a young student of information systems and is currently in his third year of study.  He attends night school because he works in the mornings and practices his career in the afternoons.  His mother is working in Spain and he lives with his father, who works as an employee.

He plans to start a computer sales, repair, and software installation business when he completes his education. 

He is asking for this loan so he can pay his tuition and be able to continue with his education as he strives to achieve his dream.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Rosa Haydee

texts.es: Rosa de 51 años de edad es una mujer que desde hace 25 años lucha por sacar adelante a su hija desde que era una bebé por circunstancias de la vida ha tenido que hacerlo sola pero su tenacidad le ha ayudado, ya que instalo un comedor en un centro turístico gracias a él que se gana la vida desde hace mucho tiempo. Ella es una mujer que no se deja vencer ante nada y es precisamente esa actitud la que le ha permitido superarse y tener su vivienda que aunque es humilde es propia por lo que se siente muy feliz. Rosa ha observado una filtración en el techo de su vivienda, por lo que no se siente tranquila y ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, polines y pines para cambiar el techo de su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Rosa, 51, is a woman who has worked to get her daughter ahead for 25 years, since she was a baby.  She had to do it alone because of life circumstances.  Her determination helped her, though, because she set up a restaurant in a tourist center.  Thanks to that, she has earned a living for a long time.

She's a woman who doesn't let herself be defeated for anything.  It's precisely that attitude that has allowed her to improve herself and get her house.  It's humble but it's hers, so she's very happy.

Rosa has seen a leak in the roof of her house.  She's concerned about it and has decided to request a loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized sheet metal, pins, and beams to change the roof of her house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal, pins, and beams to change the roof of her house

loans.name: Elmer Hernan

texts.es: Elmer de 44 años de edad vive al lado de su compañera de vida en vivienda propia desde ha ce 27 años. Él es un hombre que al perder su trabajo no se dejo amedrentar y decidió dedicarse a la venta de calzado por catalogo, actividad que realiza desde hace mucho tiempo y es gracias a ello que ha logrado sostener la economía de su hogar. Elmer en su deseo de mejorar sus ventas ha tomado la decisión de invertir en su negocio, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: zapatos de hombre, mujer y de niño para mejorar las ganancias de su negocio.
texts.en: Elmer is 44 years old. He lives by the side of his life partner in his own home for 27 years. He is a man who upon losing his job was not frightened, and decided to make a living by selling footwear for a catalog. It is a job that he has done for a long time, and thanks to it, he has managed the household expenses. Elmer's dream is to improve his sales, having made the decision to invest in his business, so he is requesting a FUSAI loan in order to invest in: men's, women's, and children's shoes, in order to improve the earnings of his business.

loans.use: to invest in: men's, women's, and children's shoes

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Gloria works hard to support her family. She has a personal products business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Gloria is borrowing 8,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) in order to buy body lotion, perfume, and other personal items.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy body lotion, perfume, and other personal items.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 10 años, tiene mucha clientela por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, Teresa está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal, para continuar con su trabajo que le da buenas ganancias  y asi tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Teresa is 45 years old, lives in her own house with her mother, and sells tortillas for a living. Her business has been located in her place of residence for 10 years. She has many customers because of her good prices and the friendliness that she has at the time of selling. Teresa is requesting a loan in order to buy quintals of corn and lime, in order to continue her job that gives her good profits and thus having better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy quintals of corn and lime.

loans.name: Mauro

texts.es: Mauro de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, el se dedica desde hace 22 años a la venta de medicina natural, su negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal,  y posee mucha clientela por la calidad del producto y los buenos precios, Mauro esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas medicina natural por mayor para poder tener mejores ganancias y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Mauro is 58 years old, and lives in a house of his own with his wife and four children. For 22 years, he has made a living selling natural medicine. His business is located in the municipal market, and has many customers because of the quality of his product and good prices. Mauro is requesting a loan in order to buy more wholesale natural medicine, so he can have better earnings and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more wholesale natural medicine.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 47 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school.

Helen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Helen aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Eseza

texts.en:
Eseza is a thirty one year old, single woman with two children living in Kasese Uganda. 

Eseza is a teacher by profession for ten years now and  likes her profession. She has a dream of going for further studies however, she is faced with the challenge of a low salary.

Eseza wants money to buy sand and bricks to build her house.

loans.use: to buy sand and bricks to build her house.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen, age 30, is a mother of three children. 

Her husband owns a tailoring shop in the market, who ch is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of tailoring material for the shop, including threads, needles, clothing etc. This is very important for him to continue his work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife, Nasreen is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. He will purchase the needed items with the help of the loan. 

Nasreen is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her husband's tailoring work.

loans.name: Sarapiyo

texts.en:
Sarapiyo is a market vendor. He is married with two children living in Hoima Uganda; they both attend school. 

He sells clothes and also farms. He has hopes of developing his business and educating his children. 

He will use the loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de maíz, vende sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con las ventas logra solventar algunos gastos del hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
This young man, age 27, has his face pixelated because he lives in a high-risk area. He is a farmer who specializes in growing corn. His products are sold at different markets that are located near his house. His sales allow him to cover some of the household expenses. He lives in his own home along with his wife and their three children.

The borrower is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, and other supplies so that he can generate better earnings.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, and other supplies.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis lives in Hoima Uganda.  He is married with three children and two attend school. He deals in produce, mainly buying and selling of maize, rice and beans. 

He has hopes of educating his children and will use the loan to buy more beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more beans to sell.

loans.name: Festo

texts.en:
Festo, 38, has been rearing cows for many years. He sells products such as milk and cattle near the area where he lives and in neighboring towns. He manages to cover some household expenses with the profits he makes. He will be able to support his family well. He is hard working and lives in a rural area. 

Festo is requesting a loan so that he can buy more cattle and continue to raise them because that is his only source of work and income.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is forty-five years old and married with seven children, who all attend school.

Robert rides a motor cycle and mainly transports people. He supplements this income by rearing pigs to sell. He will use the loan facility to buy more piglets for rearing.

He hopes to expand his piggery farm and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more piglets for rearing.

loans.name: Speaker

texts.en: Speaker deals in produce, mainly the buying and selling of beans, maize and rice among other items in Hoima, Uganda. He is a 22-year-old father of one child, who is one year old. He hopes to boost and develop his business so that he can improve his standard of living. He will use the loan to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Jovia

texts.en:
Jovia is a married woman who describes herself as determined. 

She operates a farm where she keeps cows that produce milk to sell. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be bad weather conditions. 

She will use the loan to pay school fees for her children. 

Her business goal is to excel, and she hopes that in the near future she will prosper. She will use her future profits to buy more cows for fattening.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees

loans.name: Jeninah

texts.en: Jeninah lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is a 44-year-old mother of seven children with six attending school. She runs a retail shop mainly selling sugar, salt and cooking oil, among other items. She earns an additional income from buying and selling produce. She hopes to expand her business and educate her children. She will use the loan to buy more salt and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy more salt and soap to sell.

loans.name: Surriya

texts.en:
Surriya is 38 years old. She is the mother of three children and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap biscuits, etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store as well. Some relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with monotonous tone, which is impressive, and easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relationships with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town and that is the reason why his business is running well. Due to good relationships his sales have increased a lot but he does not have sufficient stock to cope the demand. Therefore, Surriya requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etc. 

Surriya hopes that her husband will utilize the loan in positive way. It will help him to cope with the demand of the store and their family. She thanks Kiva and the field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her husband's general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bed sheets, curtains, pillowcases, comforters, duvets, and other products that he can sell door-to-door.

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel is a focussed and hard working man of 34 years who lives in rural Lyantonde. He does crop and animal husbandry concurrently to broaden his income base. 

The Ugafode loan will help Abel to buy more cattle that he will fatten and then sell after 3months. He is assured of a market during the coming Christmas season. 

Abel is grateful for the financial support since it will increase his income.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana de 46 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su nieta. Ella es una mujer con deseos de superarse por lo que al ver la necesidad de una tienda de productos básicos decidió instalar una en su vivienda hace 7 años y gracias a su visión para los negocios y su amabilidad ha logrado mantenerla por tanto tiempo. La tienda de Ana se destaca por tener una dueña que es agradable y trata muy bien a su clientela, además de ofrecer una gran variedad de productos a muy buenos precios. Ana desea invertir en su negocio para seguir atendiendo a su clientela de la mejor manera posible, `por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: huevos, aceite, azúcar, granos básicos, pan, leche, detergente, jabón, golosinas, etc. Y así mantener la variedad de productos que la caracteriza.
texts.en:
Ana is 46 years old and resides in her own home along with her granddaughter. She is a woman who has the will to get ahead. Seeing that there was a need for a store that offers basic products, Ana decided to set up a business in her home seven years ago. Thanks to her business savvy and her friendliness, she has been able to stay in operation this entire time.

Ana’s store is known for the kindness of its owner and the excellent service that is offered to its customers. In addition, she provides a wide variety of products at very good prices. Ana wants to invest in her business so that she can continue serving her customers in the best manner possible. She is requesting a loan from FUSAI so that she can invest in eggs, oil, sugar, basic grains, bread, milk, detergent, soap, snack foods, and other products. Ana will be able to maintain the variety of products that she is known for offering.

loans.use: to buy eggs, oil, sugar, basic grains, bread, milk, detergent, soap, snack foods, and other products.

loans.name: Esgar Augusto

texts.es:
Esgar Augusto tiene 28 años de edad de estado civil es conviviente, reside en el distrito de Buenos Aires, es natural de la zona, vive en casa propia, junto a su familia. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila y se dedican a ala agricultura y ganadería, además de el comercio. Dicha comunidad esta ubicada distrito de Buenos Aires, provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad a la que se dedica Esgar Augusto es a brindar el servicio de maestro de obra de construccion de viviendas, y módulos del programa del estado, esta actividad la realiza hace más de 4 años, tiene experiencia en el negocio. El destino del crédito será para la compra de calaminas para su casa, dado que se viene el verano y con ello la lluvias y Esgar Augusto desea asegurar el techo de su casa para poder tenerla en buenas condiciones para asegurar la tranquilidad y seguirdad de su familia.
texts.en:
Esgar Augusto is 28 years old and in a common-law relationship. He resides in the District of Buenos Aires and is a native of the area. Esgar and his family live in their own home. Life in his community is peaceful and the residents are known for agriculture, livestock breeding, as well as trade. His community is located in the District of Buenos Aires in Morropón Province, which is in the region of Piura on the northern coast of Peru.

Esgar Augusto’s business involves offering his services as a master home builder. He also builds government housing units. Esgar has been in business for more than four years and has the required experience. This loan will be used to buy corrugated metal sheets for his house. With the summer rains approaching, Esgar Augusto wants to secure the roof of his house so that it remains in good condition. This will allow his family to live peacefully and securely.

loans.use: to buy corrugated metal sheets for the roof of his house.

loans.name: Lorie

texts.en:
Lorie is a 32 year old, married woman with two children aged 7 and 8. She live in Concepcion, Iloilo with her husband who is a fisherman. Lorie helps her husband in their fishing business and she also sells frozen meat products. 

Lorie is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets and processed frozen meat products. Lorie is always on the look out for other small business ventures that she knows would help her family's living conditions. Her profit will be for school fees and reinvestment in the same business. 

In the future, she has plan of buying a new fishing boat and engine as a business expansion.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and processed frozen meat products.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Hoima Uganda is Kenneth's place of residence. He is aged thirty three and takes care of four children of whom three attend school. 

He rears cattle and supplements this income with farming. He hopes to expand his business and pay school fees for his children. 

He will use the loan money to buy more cows to rear.

loans.use: to buy more cows to rear.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina  lives in Suai and she is a business woman. She is applying for a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a second hand clothes shop and she is also selling in the market. 

She is taking this loan because she wants to buy more second hand clothes such as jackets, shirts, trousers, shorts, short sleeve shirts, long sleeve shirts, and other clothes to sell. Sabina has been involved in business activities since 2013, when she started with her own working capital of $200. 

Every day she is happy because many people come to buy her second hand clothes, So she is still happy to do her business. And she hopes with this loan she can grow her business to be bigger in the future. She also has animals like cows, pigs and chickens.

loans.use: to buy jackets, shirts, trousers, shorts, short sleeve shirts, long sleeve shirts, and other clothes to sell.

loans.name: Aseera

texts.en:
Aseera lives in Hoima Uganda. He is aged forty nine years old and is married with ten children of whom six attend school. 

He runs a garage mainly repairing motorcycles for people. He supplements his income by farming. He dreams of expanding his business and educating his children. 

He will use the loan facility to buy more compressors to sell.

loans.use: to buy more compressors to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Blanca de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica desde hace 10 años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Blanca esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar maíz por quintales y cal, para poder continuar con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Blanca is 51 years old and lives in her own home along with her family. She has been making and selling tortillas for the past 10 years. Her business is located in her home and she has many customers. With her sales, Blanca is able to cover some of her household expenses.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy corn by the quintal (1 quintal = 100 kg) and lime powder so that she can continue her work and improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy corn and lime powder in bulk for making tortillas.

loans.name: Areane Ara

texts.en: Areane Ara is 19 years old and single. Due to financial difficulties, she didn't pursue her studies in college. She is engaged in cooking and selling snack foods within her community to help her parents earn income to sustain their necessities and to save for her future. She aims to make her business profitable in order to gain sufficient income. Having inadequate capital, she would like to take a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy ingredients for taho and barbecue to cook and sell in the local community. Through this financial assistance, Areane Ara believes that she will improve her business and generate a higher income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make taho and barbecue to sell

loans.name: Jenawi Group

texts.en:
The Jenawi Group is led by the 46 year-old farmer Sam, who is waving his right hand in the photo. The other farmers in the group are Didi, Eno, Gito and Yatno, they are standing in front of a bio-digester that is under construction. Sam has a family with two children. All of them live in Jenawi, a small village in Karanganyar, Indonesia.

Sam has been running cow-fattening farming for more than a year. He also operates a small-scale vegetable farming. Recently, he saw the cow dungs have started to pollute the water channel near his home. He was worried that it may affect his and his family’s health. 

After socialized by Yayasan Rumah Energi and LKM (a local NGO – biogas construction partner of YRE) about Household Biogas (BIRU) program, Sam saw biogas as solution for water pollution and reducing his dependence on non- renewable cooking gas. Since Sam does not have sufficient capital to purchase a bio-digester, a loan from Kiva will help him and other farmer group members to make it possible.

He hopes that if he can build bio-digester, he can use the bio-gas for cooking, and bio-slurry (biogas residue) as fertilizers for his plantation. His family also will have an additional income if he can sell the remaining bio slurry to his neighboring farmers.

loans.use: to build bio-digester and biogas residue utilization for organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Carlos Osmin

texts.es:
Carlos de 29 años de edad, estudio un técnico en computación.  Está casado y vive con sus padres, mientras construye su propia casa.  

Carlos se dedica al darle mantenimiento a las computadoras en una oficina contable  desde hace un año, el trabajo le queda a una distancia de 10 minutos viaja en bicicleta, ya que esta ubicado en la misma zona de donde él vive. Trabaja solo por las mañanas de las 7am a las 12 del mediodía.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar 3 bolsas de cemento y arena,  para reparar la casa que el papá le ha asignado que es parte de la herencia que él les dejara.
texts.en:
Carlos is 29 years old and is studying to become a computer technician. He is married and is living with his parents while his house is being built.

Carlos is responsible for maintaining the computers at an accounting office. He has been at this job for one year and it requires him to travel 10 minutes on a bicycle. The job is located in the same area where he lives. He works alone in the mornings from 7:00 A.M. to 12 noon.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy three bags of cement and sand so that he can repair his father’s house, which will be part of the inheritance that will be left to him.

loans.use: to buy three bags of cement and sand so that he can repair his father’s house.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles, 38, is a very hardworking and responsible man. He lives in his own house with his wife and three children. He's been raising livestock and working in agriculture since 1995.  He sells his products around the area. He manages to cover some household expenses with the money he earns from sales. Charles is requesting this loan to buy more livestock so he can continue raising them and, thus, have better economic stability.

loans.use: To buy cows and sheep

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, who is in her mid 50s, is married with one son who is still at school.  She milks her cows and sells a good quantity of milk. She has been in her business for 10 years now.  She works from 5 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Sarah's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to renovate the cow shed and to vaccinate the cows in order to produce more good milk. She dreams of owning a poultry business.

Sarah will make sure that she pays her loan at the scheduled loan period.

loans.use: to renovate the cow shed and to vaccinate the cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq  femmes du groupe Danaya sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 45ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Daoudabougou  l’un des quartiers de Bamako; Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Daoudabougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (tomates), huiles rouge, poissons fumés et gombo. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1ièr cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Rokia (femme arrêtée à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des condiments ; Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 corbeilles de tomates en gros à Médine; La revente se fait  au comptant et à crédits à Daoudabougou  et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Rokia  espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien de mes enfants du foyer.
texts.en:
The five women in the Danaya group are married mostly in monogamous households. They are on average 45 years old with five children, and all live in Daoudabougou, one of the neighborhoods in Bamako. They met through neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities at the Daoudabougou market.

Group members are small retail merchants, dealing in condiments (tomatoes), red oil, smoked fish and okra. The group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso so they can replenish their stock by paying cash, and are on their first group loan cycle.

Mrs. Rokia (the woman standing on the far left in the photo) has a great reputation selling condiments. She intends to use her loan to buy three baskets of tomatoes wholesale in Medina. Retail sales are for cash and on credit  as an itinerant vendor in Daoudabougou, to a clientele consisting mainly of women.

Mrs. Rokia hopes to achieve with this loan an average monthly profit of 40,000 CFA francs, that will be reinvested in the business and used for her children's upkeep.

loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Luis Gonzalo

texts.es: Luis de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el tiene un negocio de productos varios como: shampoo, pasta dental, jabón, detergentes, sombrillas, cosméticos, etc. su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal y ya tiene 10 años de tenerlo, posee muchos clientes, Don Luis esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos todo por mayor para surtir su negocio y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Luis is 62 years old and lives in a house of his own with his wife. He has a store with products such as: shampoo, toothpaste, soap, detergents, umbrellas, cosmetics, etc. His store is located in a municipal market, and he has already had it for 10 years, and has many customers. Don Luis is requesting a loan to buy more products in bulk in order to supply his store so that he will be able to increase income.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, toothpaste, soap, detergents, umbrellas, cosmetics, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Charlene

texts.en:
Charlene is 35 years old and has four children. She is married and one of her children is in school.

Charlene is in the agricultural business, raising carabao (water buffalo) in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed for her carabao.

Charlene has been raising carabao for three years now and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Charlene would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for her carabao.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is 64 years old, married and has three children. 

Crisanta is in the agricultural business of raising cattle in the Philippines. Crisanta requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her cattle.

Crisanta has been raising cattle for five years now, and has borrowed 24 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Crisanta would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her cattle.

loans.name: Laurencia

texts.en:
Laurencia is 54 years old and married with eight children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Laurencia is borrowing 45,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her livestock.

Laurencia has been raising livestock for five years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her son

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 35-year-old married woman. She is a mother of five children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. 

Her husband started his own business of selling welding materials. Rukhsana is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan amount to buy his supply of welding products, including iron rods, iron sheets, soldering rods and welding rods so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. 

Rukhsana hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy welding products, including iron rods, iron sheets, soldering rods and welding rods.

loans.name: Samon

texts.en:
Samon, 64 years old, lives in a small community in Svay Rieng Province. He has two children in total. To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a rice farming business on farmland that is located near his house. He has been involved with this business since 1980, earning USD 2.00 per day, on average.

Samon wants to have household energy at a reduced monthly cost by purchasing a solar energy home system.  Because there is inadequate money, he has requested a Kiva loan through its partner, HKL. After this initial investment, he hopes to have clean energy to power his household lights, TV and radio. He is very happy and thankful because with this loan, HKL has provided him a special interest rate that is lower than the general loan rates. He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy home system

loans.name: Lucela

texts.en:
Lucela is 64 years old, married and has five children.

Lucela is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lucela has been raising pigs for three years now and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Lucela would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 58 years old, married and has five children. 

She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional livestock.

Virginia has been raising livestock for two years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock.

loans.name: Armando

texts.es: Don Armando tiene 62 años, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene 5 hijos, y reside vive en una aldea del Municipio de Morazán, Yoro junto a su esposa y 3 hijas. El trabajó por varios años haciendo trabajos de Herrería. Hace 15 años decidió con su esposa poner otro negocio para obtener mejores ingresos y estableció una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar, vende arroz, frijoles, azúcar, refrescos, churros, café, pan, huevos, condimentos, productos de aseo, y otros abarrotes. Y para mantener estable el negocio ha obtenido varios prestamos con la institución. Actualmente solicita otro por 10,000 Lempira para surtir la pulpería de productos como arroz, azúcar, manteca, huevos, pan, refrescos, jabón y churros. Con esta inversión va tener mas capital para trabajar. Su idea es crecer con su negocio y obtener ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Armando is 62 years old, is in a common law marriage and has five children.  They live in a Morazan, Yoro neighborhood along with three daughters.  He worked as a blacksmith for several years and he and his wife decided to set up another business so they could have a better income. They started a convenience store where they sell food products like rice, beans, sugar, soft drinks, churros, coffee, bread, eggs, condiments, toiletries, and other groceries.  He has gotten several loans through the institution, in order to keep the business stable.

He is asking for a loan of 10,000 Lempira to stock his store with things like rice, sugar, lard, eggs, bread, soft drinks, soap, and churros.  This will provide capital for him to work with. His idea is to increase his income so he can provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Chim

texts.en:
Chim, who is 35 years old, lives in a community in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. He has only one dependent child who is currently in school.  He is a garment factory worker who can make an income of USD 4.00 per day, on average. So far, he has been in this career for one year. His wife, Mach, 34, is a garment factory worker too and the earnings that she can make is approximately USD 3.33 per day, on average. 

Chim wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in his house now. Therefore, he is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, he can help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. He is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than its general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Jessica Esmeralda

texts.es: Jessica de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella posee una pequeña tienda en u lugar de residencia  donde vende pan dulce, pan francés, granos básicos, y demás productos, desde hace 11 años, tiene muchos clientes, Jessica está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos para surtir su tienda como: refrescos, golosinas, sopas, huevos, etc. y así poder tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Jessica is 30 years old, and lives in a home of her own with her husband. She owns a small store in her place of residence, where she sells Mexican sweet bread, French bread, dry grains, and other products. She has done this for 11 years and has many customers. Jessica is requesting a loan in order to buy more products to stock her store, such as: soft drinks, sweets, soup, eggs, etc., so that she can increase her earnings.
