loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sweets, soup, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase different kinds of stylish clothes to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Som Group

texts.en: Pae's village takes water from wells and from the local streams. Some people in the village, including Pae, are able to buy bottled water.  The water from natural sources in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.  Pae is excited that he, like his group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water-borne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income to users like Pae due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal, by decreasing time spent foraging for wood, and decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. The filter is guaranteed for two years, though most find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter to have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Koktong Group

texts.en:
Noy is excited that she, like her group members, was able to purchase a water filter. The silver nitrate-infused ceramic element removes and destroys bacteria and similar agents of water borne diseases. Noy's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams; however, the water from natural sources in her village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. 

Even though some people in the village, including Noy are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income available to users by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. Noy  and other filter users also decrease the amount of money spent to boil water by purchasing less charcoal and decreasing the time spent foraging for firewood. 

Noy's filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most users find the filter works from 3-5 years. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; increasing time available for productive work also improves a family’s income and over all well-being.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Thamlay Group

texts.en:
Mon's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams; however, the water from natural sources in Mon's village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water. 

Mon is excited that she, like her group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. Even though some people in the village, including Mon, are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income available to users by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. Mon and other filter users also decrease the amount of money spent to boil water by purchasing less charcoal or wood and decreasing the time spent foraging for firewood. 

Mon's filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most users find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Namalad Group

texts.en:
Viengphone is excited that she, like her group members, was able to purchase a water filter. The silver nitrate-infused ceramic element removes and destroys bacteria and similar agents of water borne diseases. Viengphone's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams; however, the water from natural sources in her village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. 

Even though some people in the village, including Viengphone, are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income available to users by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. Viengphone and other filter users also decrease the amount of money spent to boil water by purchasing less charcoal and decreasing the time spent foraging for firewood. 

Viengphone's filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most users find the filter works from 3-5 years. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; increasing time available for productive work also improves a family’s income and over all well-being.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Myla Pearl

texts.en:
Myla Pearl is 23 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Myla Pearl works very hard to provide for them.

Myla Pearl runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Myla Pearl has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Myla Pearl would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tomatoes, coffee, chocolate, sweets, bananas, cold drinks etc.

loans.name: Siguidia Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Siguidia  est majoritairement composé de monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 35ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Samè l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage.Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’encensoirs et calebasses, condiments et ustensiles plastiques. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3èmecycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Ramatou (femme arrêtée à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande renommée dans la vente des encensoirs et calebasses. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 50 calebasses et 40 encensoir en gros  avec les artisans  de Bamako. La revente s’effectue à Samè en détails à une  clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Ramatou espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif de maintenir cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’avoir beaucoup plus d’argent.
texts.en:
The Siguidia group consists mainly of monogamous women, who are on average 35 years old with four children. All live in Samè, one of the neighborhoods in Bamako, and they became acquainted through neighborhood ties.

Group members are small retail merchants dealing in incense burners and gourds, condiments and plastic utensils. Seeking to increase their stock supplies, the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are in their third group loan cycle.

Mrs. Ramatou (the woman standing on the far left in the photo) has a great reputation selling incense burners and gourds. She intends to use her loan to buy 50 gourds and 40 incense burners wholesale from craftsmen in Bamako. Retail sales are conducted in Samè to a clientele consisting mainly of women.

Mrs. Ramatou hopes to achieve with this loan an average monthly profit of 100,000 CFA francs that will be reinvested in the business. Her objective is to maintain this relation with Soro Yiriwaso so she can earn much more.

loans.use: buy incense burners and gourds

loans.name: Sarorn's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village in the Bateay Meas district of Kampot province, Sarorn is a 32-year-old married mother of one son. Rice farming and raising cows have been the main sources of her family’s income for 14 years to better support the family.  Together, they can earn about 16,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs and manage to save about 8,000 KHR each day for their future needs. 

Sarorn's group consists of three members who live in the same village. She is a second-time client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. Sarorn, who is the leader, wants to use her portion to build a latrine for use by her family. She hopes that this loan will enable her to have a decent latrine for her family.

loans.use: to build a latrine to use by her family

loans.name: Yangkom Group

texts.en: Souvanseang's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams.  However, the water from natural sources in Souvanseang's village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water. Souvanseang is excited that he, like his group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water-borne diseases. Even though some people in the village, including Souvanseang, are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income to users by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. Souvanseang and other filter users also decrease the amount of money spent to boil water by purchasing less charcoal or wood and decreasing the time spent foraging for firewood. Souvanseang's filter is guaranteed for two years, though most users find the filter works from three to five years.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter to have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en: A $1200 loan was offered to Lidia to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will use this loan to buy some additional supplies to add to her kiosk such as candles, toothpaste, perfume, soap, soy sauce, cooking oils, milk, noodles, aqua and other things to sell Including soft drinks and hard drinks. She has been involved in business activities since 2012 with her own working capital of $300.  She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future. Lidia also raises animals in her place like buffalo, pigs, chickens and goats.

loans.use: To buy candles, toothpaste, perfume, soap, soy sauce, cooking oils, milk,  noodles, aqua and other things to sell Including soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Nongfue Group

texts.en: Nokeo's village takes water from wells and from the local streams.  Some people in the village, including Nokeo, are able to buy bottled water.  The water from natural sources in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water. Nokeo is excited that he, like his group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water-borne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income to users like Nokeo due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal, by decreasing time spent foraging for wood, and decreasing  the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. The filter is guaranteed for two years, though most find the filter works from three to five years.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter to have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Djiguitougou Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de six  femmes, les membres du groupe Djiguitougou sont  mariées tous dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Daoudabougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et  leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe mènent  des activités génératrices de revenu  différent, notamment la vente de, téléphones mobiles de plusieurs marques, quincailleries, habits, grains de céréales et parures. Dans  le souci d’élargir et d’agrandir   leurs activités, elles ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont  à leur 1ère  prêt  en solidaire.
Madame Aminata (femme arrêtée à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une bonne notoriété dans la vente de téléphones portables de plusieurs marques. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 téléphones portables. Elles s’approvisionnent à Bamako.  Elle mène ses activités au comptant  à Daoudabougou à une clientèle mixtes. Madame Aminata  compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice moyen de 35 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour satisfaire son besoin et investir le reste dans son activité. Madame a pour objectif de fidéliser  ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’en profiter beaucoup de prêt.
texts.en:
Consisting of six women,  the members of the Djiguitougou group are all married into monogamous households. They are on average 35 years old with four children, and all live in Daoudabougou, one of Bamako's neighborhoods. They became acquainted through neighborhood tontines (savings groups) and their income-generating activities.

Group members have different income-generating activities, such as selling various brands of mobile phones, hardware, clothing, grain cereals, and ornaments. Seeking to increase the volume and broaden the scope of their activities, the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan cycle.

Mrs. Aminata (the woman standing on the far right in the photo) has a great reputation selling different brands of mobile phones. She intends to use her loan to buy 10 mobile phones. Cash sales are conducted in Daoudabougou to a mixed clientele.

Mrs. Aminata hopes to achieve with this loan an average monthly profit of 35,000 CFA francs, that will serve to satisfy her needs and the rest will be reinvested in the business. Her objective is to sustain this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso so she can benefit from more loans.

loans.use: buy mobile phones

loans.name: Nowtai Group

texts.en: Somphet's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams; however, the water from natural sources in Somphet's village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water. Somphet is excited that he, like his group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water-borne diseases. Even though some people in the village, including Somphet, are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income to users by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. Somphet and other filter users also decrease the amount of money spent to boil water by purchasing less charcoal or wood and decreasing the time spent foraging for firewood. Somphet's filter is guaranteed for two years, though most users find the filter works from three to five years.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter to have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru:
Мохира 26-летняя замужняя женщина, воспитывающая одного ребенка. Ее муж занимается предоставлением услуги мастера по ремонту домов. Сама Мохира вместе со свекровью занимается животноводством. 7 лет назад она научилась у нее этой деятельности и по сей день продолжает разводить скотов.
Мохира благодаря бизнесу получает доход, а также молоко от коров. Она довольна своим бизнесом и теперь когда у нее большой опыт в этой сфере, она хотела бы увеличить поголовье своих скотов. Для этой цели Мохира запрашивает кредит, поскольку собственных средств не хватает. Она надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Mohira is 26 years old, married, and has a son.  Her husband is a skilled worker in the field of home repair and remodeling.  Mohira and her mother-in-law are in the cattle business.  Mohira's mother-in-law taught her how to run this kind of business seven years ago and to this day,  Mohira continues to breed cattle. 

Thanks to the business, Mohira earns an income and has milk from her cows.  Mohira is happy with her business, and now that she has a great deal of experience in it, she would like to increase the size of her herd.  Mohira is requesting a loan because her personal savings aren't large enough to do this.  She is relying on your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 49 years old and single. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Gladys has a cross-stitch making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her business.

Gladys has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Gladys would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her cross-stitch business.

loans.name: Enoth

texts.en:
Enoth is 54 years of age and a hard worker. He is based in a rural village. He is happily married and has been blessed with five healthy looking children.

He has been practicing agriculture for the past 15 years and has never looked back. His primary source of income has been milk and crops.  He has been able to earn a decent and honest living by selling milk and bananas. These ventures have enabled him to send his children to school and feed his family.

Because of increased demand, Enoth is requesting a loan to buy two good quality dairy cows. Dairy farming is a very profitable venture and he wants to take full advantage of the ready market for dairy products.

Through the loan, Enoth is sure of satisfying the demand for milk in his area. Through increased profits, Enoth is sure that he will repay the loan on time and be in a position to comfortably take care of his family.

Enoth, with his entrepreneurial spirit, strength and tenacity, would like to continue fighting so that he can achieve his dream of owning his own business and empowering society by being a source of employment. UGAFODE, through its training, has helped Enoth to save more effectively, and through his accumulated profits, he plans to add value to his milk through packaging. He also hopes to one day start manufacturing milk products such as yoghurt.

loans.use: To buy cross breed cows

loans.name: Silviya

texts.ru:
Сильвия уже пользовалась финансовой помощью КИВА. С момента получения последней суммы бизнес у нее начал налаживаться, доход рос. Трудности были, когда не так давно умер муж и она осталась одна с 6 детьми. 
В этот раз Сильвия хотела бы сделать закупки овощей и фруктов под реализацию, а именно приобрести картошку, яблоки, морковь, апельсины, бананы и мандарины на сумму в 25 000 гривен. За счет разнообразия товара хочет увеличить приток клиентов и повысить продажи.
texts.en:
Silviya has borrowed previously with Kiva's help.  Since the time she received her last loan, her business has started to grow and her income has increased.  There have been difficulties, though, as her husband died not too long ago and she was left with six children.

This time, Silviya would like to buy fruits and vegetables for resale.  Specifically, she would like to buy potatoes, apples, carrots, oranges, bananas and mandarins for a total of 25,000 hryven (UAH).  She wants to use the wide assortment to increase her traffic flow and increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Honronya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Honronya est composé de dix  femmes mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 41ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Badialan III l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont  connues à travers des liens de voisinage.Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de produits cosmétiques (mèches), des chaussures plastiques, de la farine et d’habits. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Bougouri  (femme arrêtée devant  à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des condiments (oignons). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 8 sacs d’oignons en gros à Médine. La revente se fait en détails à Badialan III à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes. Madame Bougouri  espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Honronya group consists of ten women, married for the most part in monogamous households. They are on average 41 years old with three children. All live in Badialan III, one of Bamako's neighborhoods, and became acquainted through neighborhood ties.

Group members are small retail merchants, dealing in beauty products (hair extensions), plastic shoes, flour and clothing. The group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso so they can replenish their supplies by paying cash, and are on their third group loan cycle.

Mrs. Bougouri (the woman standing on the far right in the photo) has a great reputation selling condiments (onions). She intends to use her loan to buy eight bags of onions wholesale in Medina. Retail sales are conducted in Badialan III to a clientele consisting mainly of women.

Mrs. Bougouri hopes to achieve with this loan an average monthly profit of 150,000 CFA francs, that will be reinvested in her business activity. Her objective through this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso is to buy a building plot.

loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Hon

texts.en:
Hon, who is 35 years old, is living in a community in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has two unmarried children and one married child. To support the family, she is working very hard on her own rice farmland by growing and selling the crop to the local dealers and customers in the market. The net profit that she can generate is USD 2.50 a day, on average.

Besides being a rice farmer, she has another agricultural business, which is raising ducks to sell. Currently, she is requesting a loan from KHL to buy duck food for her ducklings. With the support from this loan, she hopes that it can help all of her ducklings grow better and faster. She is thankful for the lenders generous behaviors.

loans.use: to buy duck food

loans.name: Kototala Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe Kototala est constitué de cinq  femmes  majoritairement mariées dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 36 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Daoudabougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et  leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font du commerce,  tel que la vente de fruits (pastèques), colas, huiles et charbon de bois.  Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de rejoindre  Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 1ier   prêt en prêt solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata  (femme arrêtée en 2ème position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des fruits (pastèques). Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 100 pastèques à Médine. Elles s’approvisionnent  à  Médine. La revente s’effectue à Daoudabougou au comptant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Fatoumata  compte réaliser  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 60 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour satisfaire les petits besoins de ses enfants et investir le reste dans ses activités. Madame compte beaucoup sur le partenariat  de Soro Yiriwaso pour l’atteinte de ses objectifs qui est l’élargissement de son activité.
texts.en:
The five women in the Kototala group are married for the most part in monogamous households. They are on average 36 years old with five children, and all live in Daoudabougou, one of Bamako's neighborhoods. They became acquainted through neighborhood tontines (savings groups) and their income-generating activities.

Group members are retail merchants who sell fruit (watermelons), cola soft drinks, cooking oil and charcoal. The group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso so they can increase their stock supplies, and they are on their first group loan cycle.

Mrs. Fatoumata (the woman standing in the second position from left to right in the photo) has a great reputation selling fruit (watermelons). She intends to use her loan to buy 100 watermelons in Medina. Retail sales are conducted for cash in Daoudabougou, to a clientele consisting mainly of women.

Mrs. Fatoumata hopes to achieve with this loan an average monthly profit of 60,000 CFA francs, that will serve to satisfy her children's small needs, and the rest will be reinvested in her business activity. She is is relying on the partnership with Soro Yiriwaso to attain her objective, which is to expand her activity.

loans.use: buy fruit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a second round of farm supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Marina Del Carmen

texts.es: Marina es una microempresaria emprendedora, tiene la edad de 44 años, casada y madre de tres hijos, dependiendo económicamente de ella dos, comercializa productos varios en su domicilio como es carne de pollo y mercadería de ropa, lleva tres ciclo de estar trabajando con los financiamiento de la institución, por lo que asegura que uno de sus logros es el incremento y diversificación en los productos ofrecidos, esto la ha motivado para solicitar el crédito e invertir en la compra de queso, crema, pierna de pollo, pechuga especial, pechuga con ala, blusas, camisetas, talladores, brazieres, blúmer, bóxer, etc., de modo que podrá satisfacer a la población con los productos que más demandan y de esta manera mejorara sus ingresos.
texts.en: Marina is a small business owner.  She is 44 years old, married and the mother of three children, two of which depend on her economically.  She sells several products from home such as chicken meat and clothing.  She has been working with loans from the institution for three cycles and claims one of her achievements has been the increase and diversification of her products.  This has motivated her to request a loan to buy cheese, cream, chicken legs, special chicken breast, breast with wings, and clothing such as blouses, t-shirts, shapewear, bras, briefs, boxers, etc.  This is so she can satisfy the demand for the most popular products and improve her income.

loans.use: To buy clothing merchandise and chicken meat.

loans.name: Argelia Saraí

texts.es:
Argelia de 28 años de edad,  es madre soltera de tres hijos,  estudio hasta bachillerato ya que no se le dio la oportunidad de seguir estudiando.  Vive con sus tres hijos y los dos abuelos, dos de sus hijos están estudiando el otro se lo cuida la abuela cuando ella sale a trabajar.


Argelia se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo desde hace tres años, este oficio se lo enseño una amiga que le pidió que le ayudara a vender productos de esta revista y fue así como ella decidió independizarse en el negocio, anteriormente se dedicaba a cuidar unos niños en una casa, pero los niños se los llevaron para estados Unidos.  

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar ropa y salir a vender, ya que ella sale a vender productos de la revista y ahí aprovechar de llevar la ropa,  ella considera que esto le dará más ingresos para que sus hijos puedan estudiar y salgan adelante.

Sus sueños son establecer un local en donde vender la ropa, que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Argelia, 28, is a single mother with three children.  She got as far as high school but did not have the opportunity to continue.  She lives with her three children and the grandparents.  Two of her children attend school and the other one is looked after by the grandmother when Argelia goes out to work.

She sells beauty products by catalogue and has been in business for three years.  A friend of hers taught her about the business by asking her to help sell the products, so she then decided to become independent.  She used to babysit other children in her home but they moved to the United States.

The loan she is requesting is to buy clothing to go out and sell.  Since she goes out with her catalogues, she wants to take advantage and sell clothing at the same time.  She feels this will increase her income so her children can study and get ahead.

Her goals are to open a clothing shop and to provide her children with an education so they can become professionals.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Kototala Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kototala est constitué de dix femmes  tous mariées et vie majoritairement  dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 41 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes Badialan III l’un des quartiers  de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et  leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font du commerce,  tel que la vente de condiments, des fruits et légumes  (tomate, oignons, chou, gombo et autres …).  Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de rejoindre  Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 3ème   prêt en prêt solidaire.
Madame Malado (femme arrêtée en 4ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des ustensiles plastiques de plusieurs genres à Badialan III. Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 20 pièces d’ustensiles différentes. Elles s’approvisionnent  à Bamako. La revente s’effectue à Badialan III au comptant et parfois en crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Malado  compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 150 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour satisfaire les petits besoins de ses enfants et investir le reste dans ses activités. Madame compte beaucoup sur le partenariat  de Soro Yiriwaso pour l’atteinte de ses objectifs qui est l’élargissement de son activité.
texts.en:
The Kototala group is made up of ten women who are all married; the majority of them live in polygamous families. They average 41 years of age with four children each and all live in Badialan III, a district of Bamako. They got to know each other through the "tontine" system (a revolving finance system whereby each member contributes periodically an agreed amount and this is passed on in rotation to other group members) and through their income-generating activities. The group members have small trading businesses, such as selling condiments, fruit and vegetables (tomatoes, onions, cabbage, gombo and others). They decided to join Soro Yiriwaso in order to expand their businesses and are on their third group loan. 

Malado (who is standing fourth from the right on the photo) has a good reputation for selling plastic utensils of various kinds in Badialan III. She is planning to use this loan to buy 20 different utensils. She gets her provisions in Bamako and sells her goods in Badalian III for cash and sometimes on credit to a primarily female customer base. 

With this loan, Malado is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 150,000FCFA, which will be used to provide for her children's small needs and reinvest in her business. She is counting heavily on this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso in order to achieve her objective of expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy several sorts of plastic utensils.

loans.name: Baara Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Baara  est composé équitablement de  femmes polygames et monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Lafiabougou l’un des quartiers  de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits (pagnes wax) de toutes les qualités, des  friperies, la restauration et charbon du bois. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Awa (femme arrêtée à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des habits (pagnes wax). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  20 pièces de pagne  wax  en gros à  Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Lafiabougou et en ambulant à une clientèle mixte. Madame  Mariétou espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif de réinvestir dans l’activité et subvenir aux petit besoin de la famille.
texts.en:
The Baara group is made up equally of polygamous and monogamous women. They average 33 years of age with three children each and all live in Lafiabougou, a district of Bamako. They got to know each other as neighbors, and have small businesses either practising restauration or selling clothing ("pagnes wax", which are brightly colored pieces of African cloth) of all qualities, second-hand clothing and charcoal. The group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to get fresh supplies for cash and are on their third group loan. 

Awa (who is standing on the far left of the photo) has a good reputation for selling clothing ("pagnes wax"). She is planning to use her loan to buy 20 pieces of pagne wax wholesale in Bamako. She sells her goods in Lafiabougou on a retail basis, door-to-door to a mixed customer base.  

With this loan, Awa is hoping to make an average monthly profit of 90,000FCFA, which will be used to reinvest in her business. Her aim is to continue investing in her business and provide for her family's small needs.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Thongphankham Group

texts.en:
Soukanya's village takes water from wells and from the local streams. Some people in the village, including Soukanya, are able to buy bottled water.  The water from natural sources in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.    

Soukanya is excited that he, like his group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. 

The water filter also increases disposable income to users like Soukanya due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal, by decreasing time spent foraging for wood, and decreasing  the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Emeline

texts.en:
Emeline is 42 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are in school, she is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Emeline has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Emeline requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fish to sell.

Emeline has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Emeline would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Islomiddin

texts.en: Islomiddin is 22 years old. He is a young and hardworking man. He is married and bringing up a little child. He is a student of the 5th course. Islomiddin studies at Tajikistan State University Commerce. He learns economy. Islomiddin studies well. He tries to get good knowledge to find a job after graduating from the university. Islomiddin now needs financial support. He must pay for his university tuition. He is asking for a loan of 1,400 USD to pay for tuition. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for his tuition

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
Arnold is a first-time borrower of the institution and is applying for 1,500,000 UGX. He is a married young man with two young children that he takes care of with the help of his wife. He operates a soft drinks and beer depot on the outskirts of the city, which is still on a low scale. He says he has many customers, especially retailers, around his depot that come to be served but he fails to serve some of them since his stock is still small. He thought of a way of seeing himself out of this situation and opted to borrow money from Ugafode. He says that when given the 1,500,000 UGX loan, he will be able to boost his working capital and serve his customers.

Arnold’s future hope is seeing his business grow into a serious depot and being able to buy land for his family.

loans.use: To buy a stock of sodas

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe Benkan est constitué de quatre femmes  tous mariées et vie équitablement dans des ménages polygamiques et monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 34 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Ouolofobougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et  leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font du commerce,  tel que la vente de,  légumes (concombres et carottes)  condiments.  Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de rejoindre  Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 4ème  prêt en prêt solidaire.
Madame Sanoudjé (femme arrêtée à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des  légumes (concombres et carottes) à Ouolofobougou. Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 4 corbeilles de concombres et  3 paniers de carottes. Elles s’approvisionnent  à Médine. La revente s’effectue à Ouolofobougou au comptant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Sanoudjé compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 140 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour satisfaire les petits besoins de ses enfants et investir le reste dans ses activités. Madame compte beaucoup sur le partenariat  de Soro Yiriwaso pour l’atteinte de ses objectifs qui est l’élargissement de son activité.
texts.en:
The Benkan group is made up of four women who are all married and live equally in polygamous and monogamous households. They average 34 years of age with two children each and all live in Ouolofobougou, a district of Bamako. They got to know each other through their district's "tontine" system (a revolving finance system whereby each member contributes periodically an agreed amount and this is passed on in rotation to other group members) and through their income-generating activities. The group members have small trading businesses, such as selling vegetables (cucumbers and carrots and condiments. They decided to join Soro Yiriwaso in order to expand their businesses and are on their fourth group loan. 

Sanoudjé (who is standing on the far left of the photo) has a good reputation for selling vegetables (cucumbers and carrots) in Ouolofobougou. She is planning to use this loan to buy four baskets of cucumbers and three baskets of carrots. She gets her provisions in Medine and sells her produce in Ouolofobougou for cash to a primarily female customer base. 

With this loan, Sanoudjé is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 140,000FCFA, which will be used to provide for her children's small needs and reinvest in her business. She is counting heavily on this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso in order to achieve her objective of expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru:
Наталия занимается торговлей женской обувью — от тапочек до сапог. Работает на центральном рынке г.Белая Церковь 3-5 дней в неделю. В этой сфере торговли занята уже 20 лет. Опыт работы солидный, с клиентами обходится очень умело. Торговое место на рынке на данный момент арендует. Наталии 56 лет, она замужем, имеет двух взрослых сыновей и двух внуков. 
Наталия планирует закупить новую сезонную зимнюю женскую обувь на сумму в 31 000 гривен. Наталия аккуратная, активная, взвешенная и рациональная. Умеет мудро руководить как домом, так и и бизнесом. Товар у нее ходовой, пользуется спросом у клиенток.
texts.en:
Nataliya sells all kinds of women's shoes -- from slippers to boots.  She works at the central market in Belaya Tserkov three to five days a week.  She's been working in this field for 20 years already.  She has a great deal of experience and she relates very well with her customers.  At the moment, she rents her retail space at the market.  She is 56 years old, married, and she has two adult sons and two grandchildren.

Nataliya is planning to use 31,000 hryvnia to buy a new assortment of women's winter shoes. She is accurate, dynamic, well-balanced and levelheaded.  She is equally good at running her home and her business.  Her merchandise is very popular; she receives a high demand from her customers.

loans.use: to buy more winter shoes.

loans.name: Ahmmed

texts.en:
Ahmmed is a 41 year old, educated man with a Secondary education. He is a married man with four children, living with his family in a humble area of Haja city, Yemen. 

Ahmmed is the sole breadwinner of the family. He has a small grocery which lacks many food items and other things. The grocery is the sole source of income for Ahmmed's family. He has great determination to get ahead and to provide his family with a better future. 

Ahmmed can't face all the demands of his customers. He needs financial support to increase his business capital. For this reason, Ahmmed applied for a loan of 400,000 YER from AMB. He will use it to purchase different kinds of food materials and items to attract more customers which will help him to increase his business more.

Ahmmed looks forward to expanding his business more in order to be able to meet all the demands of his customers.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of foods and other items to attract more customers.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
From Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Phalla, 26, is an experienced and active farmer. By operating a farming business on a small rice field, she can earn around USD 2.50 a day to support her family's daily expenses. She is a lovely mother of two dependent children who are enrolling in the local school.

To accelerate her farming operation, Phalla would like to use cows to help her in the farming process. Because there is a shortage of money, she would like to get a Kiva loan to buy cows. With the support from this loan, she hopes that she can operate her farming better and faster. She also thanks all the lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.en:
Due to financial hardship, Eloisa is engaged in the hog-raising business to help her husband gain income. She is 41 years old and has four children in school. 

She and her husband want to improve their standard of living and educate their children so that they will become professionals in the future. With this in mind, Eloisa wants to improve her hog-raising business to increase her income. Having inadequate capital, she would like to take a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy hog feed, vitamins, vaccines and additional pigs to raise. 

She is hoping that she will be approved for her loan request to be able to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins, vaccines and additional pigs to raise.

location.town: Brgy. San Juan, Solano, Nueva Vizcay

loans.name: Anargul

texts.ru:
Анаргул 39 летняя жительница маленького района под названием Чилинкул. Она мама троих детей и верная жена. Ее муж и старший сын работают строителями. Анаргул ранее работала учительницей, но она выбрала совсем иную деятельность приносящий больше дохода, чтобы прокормить семью. Анаргул уже много лет занимается скотоводством. У нее не большое количество скотин и с обязанностями скотовода она справляется безупречно. 
   Анаргул считает, что набралась большого опыта в этой сфере, чтобы всерьез развиваться в этом направлении. Она планирует получить кредит и потратить все деньги до копейки на приобретения скотин и корма для них. Анаргул верит, что ее ждет удача и ее планы реализуются.
texts.en:
Anargul is a 39-year-old resident of a small district in Tajikistan named Jilikul.  She is the mother of three children and a faithful wife.  Her husband and oldest son work as builders.  Anargul used to work as a school teacher, but she switched to a completely different, more profitable, activity, in order to be able to feed her family.  Anargul has been involved in animal husbandry for many years already.  She owns a few head of livestock and does an excellent job taking care of them.

Anargul thinks that she has gained enough experience in her field of work to seriously consider expanding in this direction.  She is planning to get a loan and she will spend its entire amount to buy livestock and livestock feed.  She believes that she will be successful and that she will be able to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy livestock and grow her business.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is a married woman with three children. Annie is 38 years old and all of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Annie has a dry goods business in the Philippines. Annie requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of foot-wear, school supplies and toys.

Annie has been in this business for five years. In the future, Annie would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of foot-wear, school supplies and toys.

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Kong Pisey district of Kampon Spue province, Sokhom is 42 and widowed. She has three children. To support the family, she has been faming rice and working as a garment worker for 24 years. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR per day. 

Sokhom has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to build a latrine for her family to use. 

She hopes to make a better living.

loans.use: to build a latrine for her family to use.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Korng Pisey District

loans.name: Rajabkhon

texts.ru:
Рачабгул 38 летняя жительница городка Турсунзаде. Городок был назван в честь великого таджикского писателя Мирзо Турсун-заде, героя таджикского народа. В этом городе Рачабгул с семьей живут давно. Она замужем, но ее муж находиться на заработках в России. Дети учатся в школе. 
   Рачабгул около 12 лет занимается шитьем женской одежды. Она влюблена в свою работу и старается все время самосовершенствоваться. За столь время она работала на этой машинке, которую Вы видите на фотографии. Машинка совсем устарела и качественно не выполняет работу. Рачабгул надеется на получения кредита и приобретения новой современной швейной машинки. Новая швейная машинка стоить дорого и Рачабгул надеется только на кредит, чтобы продолжить работу и сохранить источник дохода.
texts.en:
Rajabkhon is 38 years old and a resident of the town of Tursun-zoda, named in honor of the famous Tajik writer Mirzo Tursunzoda, a national hero of Tajikistan.  Rajabkhon and her family have been living there for a long time.  Rajabkhon is married, but her husband is currently working in Russia.  Her children are still in school.

Rajabkhon has been sewing women's dresses for close to 12 years.  She loves her work and is always eager to perfect her skills.  For the longest time, she's been using the sewing machine that you can see in the photo.  It is an old machine which hardly works.  Rajabkhon hopes that she will receive a loan to buy a new, modern, sewing machine.  However, new sewing machines cost a lot of money and Rajabkhon relies entirely on this loan to continue her work and keep her source of income.

loans.use: to buy a new, modern, sewing machine.

loans.name: Yiriwa Group

texts.fr:
Mariées uniquement dans des ménages polygamiques, les quatre  membres du groupe Yiriwa ont en moyenne 33 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Ouolofobougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu à Ouolofobougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, poisons, pommes de terre et restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Marama (femme arrêtée à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une vendeuses de poissons. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 paniers  de poissons en gros au quartier du fleuve. La revente se fait en détails à Ouolofobougou et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame  Marama compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married exclusively into polygamous family frameworks, each of the four members of the Yiriwa Group are on average 33 years old with an average of two children each. They all live in Ouolofobougou, one of the districts of Bamako, and they all know each other through the bonds of community and their revenue-generating activities. The members of this group sell fish, potatoes and run their own food stalls. In order to increase their working capital, the group members decided to collaborate alongside Soro Yiriwaso. This will be their fourth group loan.

Marama (the woman to the far right of the photo) sells fish. She plans on using this loan to purchase two baskets of fish from the riverside district. She will then sell the fish in Ouolofobougou as a street vendor to a customer base comprised mostly of women. With this loan, Marama plans on making an average monthly profit of 90,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested into her business and used to pay for her household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fish

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a hardworking mother who was engages in the hog-raising business to supplement her husband's income. She is 45 years old and has two children attending school. 

Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, she needs to increase her income to meet the necessities of her family. She wants to improve her hog-raising business but she doesn't have enough capital. For this reason, she would like to takea loan of PHP 10,000 to buy hog feed, vitamins and vaccines for her hogs. 

With this financial assistance, she hopes that she will further improve her business.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins and vaccines for her hogs.

location.town: Brgy. San Juan, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Tamara

texts.ru:
Тамара занимается тепличным хозяйством на протяжении 22 лет. Благодаря предыдущему кредиту Тамара смогла построить дополнительную теплицу. Она целеустремленная и трудолюбивая. Тамара хочет развивать бизнес и увеличивать доход семьи.

Тамара просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 40 000 гривен на установку системы парового отопления в теплицах. Она планирует получить доход с продажи ранних овощей.
texts.en:
Tamara has been involved in greenhouse farming for the past 22 years.  Thanks to her previous loan, she was able to build an additional greenhouse.  She is goal-oriented and hardworking.  She wants to grow her business and increase her family's income.

Tamara is requesting a loan of 40,000 hryvnia to install a steam heating system in her greenhouses.  She is planning to make some money from the sale of early vegetables.

loans.use: to install a steam heating system in her greenhouses.

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Phat,43 years old, is a married woman who lives in Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. She has only one married child. To earn a living, she manages and operates a farming business by growing rice and selling to the local dealers. Besides being a farmer, she makes Khmer cake (Kreab) to sell in the center of her community. The total income that she can make is USD 5.00 per day, on average. 

Phat wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is taking a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than its general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Salmon

texts.en: Salmon is a very clever boy. He graduated school with excellence and good marks. He was one of the best pupils in his school. He likes math, computers, geography and other subjects. His hobby is playing tennis. His classmates like him very much. This year he has entered the Public Managing University of Tajikistan. His parents are workers. Their income is too small to pay for Salmon’s studies at the university. He is asking for a loan of 1000 USD to pay for his tuition at the university. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 57 years old and married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Margarita has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. Margarita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell.

Margarita has been in this business for three years. In the future, Margarita would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mehar Ul Nisa

texts.en: Mehar ul Nisa, 37, is the mother of two children. She  lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For man days, his rickshaw has not been working properly, so he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. Therefore, Mehar ul Nisa has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Mehar ul Nisa is so thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Bagdagul

texts.ru: Багдагуль 61 год, замужем, мать 4 детей. У Багдагуль среднее образование, по характеру, спокойная, целеустремленная. У нее большой опыт в животноводстве и полеводстве, на протяжении 34 лет, она занимается откормом скота и продажей молока. Начала этот бизнес с покупки одной коровы и 10 овец. Благодаря упорному труду Багдагуль, в хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 коровы, 3 лошади и 20 овец . Ее деятельность приносит около 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Багдагуль обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку ячменя и жмыха в качестве корма для скота. Доходы от кредита Багдагуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства.
texts.en: Bagdagul is 61 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She has the equivalent of a high school education.  By nature, she is a quiet and goal-oriented woman.  She has a great deal of experience in animal husbandry and agriculture.  She has been fattening livestock and selling milk for 34 years.  She started in this business with the purchase of one cow and 10 sheep.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently owns three cows, three horses and 20 sheep.  Her activity brings her close to 20,000 som (KGS) per month, which just covers the cost of food and her family's every-day expenses.  In order to further develop her business, Bagdagul has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy barley and oil-cake as feed for her livestock.  She plans to re-invest the earnings from her loan into further expanding her animal husbandry business.

loans.use: to purchase barley and oil-cake as a feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
Edilberto se desempeña exitosamente en su negocio de fabricación de molduras y muebles en madera, siendo una persona muy reconocida en el barrio por su buen trabajo y servicio. 

Ya que ha laborado 7 años con los conocimientos que adquirió por medio de su trabajo en distintos talleres, ha tenido la oportunidad de mantener su trabajo y ha intentado mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. 

Por esta razón quiere solicitar un crédito para realizar el mantenimiento a una de sus sierras industriales, además necesita comprar materia prima como madera.

Con estos elementos podrá continuar prestando su servicio ya que la herramienta que utiliza esta en mal estado.

Actualmente es vive en unión libre con su esposa y tiene dos hijos menores por  los cuales siempre trata de ayudar económicamente para que puedan sustentar su hogar y mejorar su vida. 

Su mayor sueño es poder tener un gran taller con varios empleados y poco a poco podrá lograr su objetivo. 

Ayuda a un joven emprendedor con ganas de salir adelante con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Edilberto works in his successful business making mouldings and furniture. He is well-known in the neighbourhood for the good work and service he offers. As he has worked for seven years with the knowledge he gained in different workshops, he has been able to continue working and improve his family's living conditions.

This is why he wants a loan, to carry out maintenance on one of his industrial saws, and to buy raw materials such as wood. This will allow him to continue offering his services as the tool he uses is in poor condition. 

He lives with his partner, and has two young children. He always tries to support them economically so that they can look after the home and improve their lives. 

His biggest dream is to have a large workshop with various employees and little by little, he will achieve his goal. Help a young entrepreneur who wants to move forwards with a loan!

loans.use: to carry out maintenance on one of his industrial saws, and to buy raw materials such as wood.

loans.name: Compressor Group

texts.en:
Amina, who is in her early 30s, is married with one kid who is still small.  She has been running  two projects, selling drinking water and a beauty salon.  She has been in her business for five years now.  She works from 06 am to 08 pm daily, and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Amina's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to start selling water and also increased the salon equipment.  She is doing great, and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit for household expenses.  She dreams of building her own house.  

Amina will share this loan with her loan group, "COMPRESSOR", which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan

loans.use: to increase drinking water stock and to buy good quality salon products

loans.name: Munargul

texts.ru: Мунаргул 44 года, замужем, мать 2 детей. У нее среднее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав в 1999 году с суммы 20,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду, Мунаргул на сегодняшний день имеет 4 коровы, 12 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 5 коров стоимостью 30,000 сом (KGS) каждая. Скот Мунаргул будет содержать в сараях, сено и корм на зиму уже заготовлен. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность улучшить условия проживания ее семьи.
texts.en: Munargul is 44 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She has a secondary education.  She is involved in animal husbandry, an activity which provides her family with its main source of income.  She started in this business in 1999 with an initial capital of 20,000 som (KGS).  Munargul has worked extremely hard and she currently owns four cows and 12 sheep.  In order to further develop her animal husbandry business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 15,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy five cows, each priced at 30,000 som (KGS).  Munargul already has stables to keep her cows, as well as hay and feed for the winter.  She is planning to invest the earnings from her loan into further expanding her animal husbandry business, and to be able to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase five cows for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en:
Due to the hardship of living, Estrelita operates their motorcycle transport to generate income. She is 25 years old, and blessed with two children attending school. She and her husband work hand and hand to earn a living and sustain the necessities of their family. 

To continuously operate the motorcycle, she would like to access financial assistance amounting to PHP 9,000 to buy gasoline, spare parts and accessories needed for the maintenance of her motorcycle. 

She hopes that she will earn a higher income and sustain the necessities of her family.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, spare parts and accessories needed for the motorcycle

location.town: Brgy. San Juan, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy material for her husband's shuttering work.

loans.name: Zakria

texts.en:
Zakria is a 42-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband has been running a general store for past two years; only he is responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family. Zakria's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities e.g rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purpose. 

But due to financial constraints, he is not in a suitable position to buy all above these products for reselling purposes. Therefore Zakria has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and also be helpful for him to earn the maximum profitable income to manage his household and business. 

Zakria is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase different commodities, eg rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is 49 years old, and she lives in the village Achajur of Tavush region. She lives with her son’s family and she already has three grandchildren. Anahit’s son has a car and in addition to farming, he also earns money by doing cargo transfers by order on his track. 

Anahit, after her husband’s death, became very skilled in farming, since it is the main source of income for her not small family. In her farm she has 20 sheep, several piglets and she also cultivates wheat on her land; she has apple and peach trees. Anahit especially pays attention to her vineyard, which gives a perfect harvest of grapes. She sells the grapes to winemakers from surrounding areas. Anahit’s son helps her in agricultural and farming activities, and together they try to sustain their family's needs.
 
She is asking for this loan to organize autumn sowing activities on her land, and and to buy cords and pillars for her vineyard.

loans.use: to organize autumn sowing activities on her land, and to buy cords and pillars for her vineyard

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit lives in Sevan city in the Gegharkunik region, and she sends her greetings to Kiva and Nor Horizon for her previous successful three deals. All her partnerships have the same aim; she paid for her daughter’s education. 

Now she also has one Kiva loan which she asked for paying her daughter’s second semester tuition fee. Anahit works as an accountant simultaneously in two places, and her husband is still in his previous work (at the flour mill plant as the head of production); she says despite of working in several places at the same time, still they could not solve the problem of their daughter’s tuition fee. Anyway, she is happy that she found Kiva, and it still helps her to solve her financial problems with such convenient loan conditions.

This time again, Anahit will be greatly happy and thankful to already have her fourth Kiva loan; she will use it to pay for her daughter’s tuition fee for the first semester.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s tuition fee for the first semester

loans.name: Grupo Xojola 4 Group

texts.es:
La agricultura es una actividad solamente apta para toda aquella persona que ama la tierra como a una madre, como una engendradora de futuros para la vida.  Buenos futuros de esperanzas para generaciones siguientes. Mujeres emprendedoras no hacen falta en el país de la eterna primavera que es Guatemala donde la mujer forma parte importante en los campos laborales, tal es el caso de Elena de 28 años de edad que tiene 2 hijos los cuales son estudiantes en la escuela de su comunidad. (Elena es la que se encuentra de 1ra de derecha a izquierda en la fotografía)

La actividad que ella desempeña con tanto orgullo es la producción de banano en los campos fértiles de su comunidad dicho trabajo lo ha venido realizando desde hace 15 años y genera buena ganancia para la economía de su familia ya que es la herencia que su padre le pudo dejar para que ella tenga una calidad de vida mejor en el futuro.

El uso respectivo que Elena le dará al préstamo que solicita es para el mantenimiento de banano  para que produzcan sus frutos y sean llevados en los mercados de la comunidad para su respectiva venta.

Ella es un ejemplo a seguir en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de mujeres se decidieron unirse con Elena para poder sacarles el provecho máximo de las tierras de su comunidad ya que está llena de vida para producir cualquier producto agrícola.

Los sueños de ella es la plantación de más banano en las tierras fértiles con que ella cuenta y de esa manera ella quiere apoyar al medio ambiente y así mismo sacar un provecho económico para su familia para que lleguen a profesionales en el futuro.
texts.en:
Agriculture is an activity which is suitable only for those who love the earth like a mother, like an instigator of futures: good futures full of hope for the next generation. Entrepreneurial women are not lacking in Guatemala, the country of the eternal Spring, where women play an important part in agriculture. This is the case for 28 year old Elena. She has 2 children, who are students at the local school. She is the first on the right in the photograph.   

The work that she performs with such pride is the production of bananas in the fertile fields of the community. She has been doing this work for 15 years and she makes a good income for her household. This work is the inheritance that her father was able to leave her to ensure that she would have a better quality of life in the future. 

Elena is planning to use the loan for the upkeep of her banana trees. This is so that they can produce fruit which can be taken to the markets in the community and sold. 

Elena is an example for others to follow in her community. For this reason, a group of women decided to join Elena in order to take full advantage of the land their community has to offer, since it is so full of life and can produce a huge variety of agricultural products. 

Elena's dream is to plant more banana trees in the fertile land that she has. In this way she wishes to support the environment and also make a decent income for her family so that they can become professionals in the future.

loans.use: maintain their banana trees.

loans.name: Edy Lorena

texts.es: Edy de 29 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que no se deja vencer por las necesidades, lejos de eso las utiliza para ganarse la vida. Edy habita junto a sus padres y sus 2 hijos de 9 y 3 años de edad en vivienda propia desde hace 29 años. Ella tiene el firme deseo de seguir mejorando las condiciones de vida de su familia por lo que todos los días se levanta desde muy temprano para preparar los ingredientes a utilizar en el platillo que ha decidido vender ese día, entre los que están: atoles, pasteles de carne, refrescos, yuca, conservas de coco, etc. Y es gracias a ello que ha logrado salir adelante, como madre soltera sabe que tiene una doble responsabilidad y es por ello que su esfuerzo es doble. Edy sabe que su negocio puede dar mejores ganancias si le invierte por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: harinas, leche, maíz, carne, yuca, conservas, etc. Para preparar los productos que vende.
texts.en: Edy is 29 years old. She is a hardworking woman who does not let herself be overcome by necessity. On the contrary, she is motivated by it to earn her living. Edy has lived with her parents and her two children, who are 9 and 3 years old, in her own house for 29 years. She has the strong wish to keep on improving her family's quality of life. This is why she gets up very early every day to use the ingredients and prepare the dish she has decided to sell that day. Among these dishes are: atoles (hot corn beverages), meat pies, beverages, cassava, coconut dessert, etc. Thanks to this business she has been able to move ahead. As a single mother, she knows that she has double responsibility, and this is why she works twice as hard. Edy knows that her business can give her more earnings if she invests in it. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to FUSAI to buy: flours, milk, corn, meat, cassava, canned goods, etc. so she can prepare the products she sells.

loans.use: to buy flours, milk, corn, meat, cassava, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan pablo es un joven emprendedor de 23 años de edad que aprovecho que en su sector no había un negocio que ofertara los servicios de barbería y se capacito y monto su propio negocio y hoy puede contar con dos empleados y su idea es seguir progresando para darle un bienestar a sus dos hijos de 6 y 2 años de edad, lo maravilloso de esta persona es que ama su profesión y es feliz realizando su actividad incluso trabaja 12 – 14 horas diarias y su idea es poder modernizar el negocio y hacerlo ver como a las tradicionales barberías americanas y por esta razón solicita un crédito para hacerles unas modificaciones y unas compras y ver su local más estético y más cerca de la verdadera esencia de una barbería pues piensa que sería más tractivo para atraer clientes.
Su sueño es ver convertida su barbería en todo un salón americano.
texts.en:
Juan Pablo is a young entrepreneur, just 23 years old, who took advantage of the fact that in his sector there were no businesses that offered barber shop services.  He trained himself and set up his own business, and today he has two employees. His intention is to continue making progress in order to provide a wellbeing for his two children, who are 2 and 6 years old.  

What is wonderful about this person is that he loves his profession and is happy doing his job, which includes working 12 to 14 hours a day.  His intention is to modernize the business and make it look like the traditional American barber shops.  It is for this reason that he asks for a loan to make some modifications and purchases and to see his place become more aesthetic and closer to the true essence of a barber shop, since he believes that it would be more appealing to attract clients.

His dream is to convert his barber shop into an all-American salon.

loans.use: to make renovations to his business in order to make it look like the classic American barber shops.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María de 42 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, es madre soltera de 3 hijos.
	

María se dedica a los oficios domésticos del hogar, pero desea iniciar un negocio que consiste en una tienda en su casa,  ya que está en una ubicación  donde pasa bastante gente y es un lugar céntrico  que le funcionara muy bien. Actualmente tiene productos a la venta pero son bastantes, por lo que desea mejorar su negocio  Anteriormente ella se dedicaba a vender en una tienda donde le pagaban por su servicio y fue de ahí donde obtuvo experiencia para vender. En el negocio está dispuesto a colaborar su madre para que ella  inicie el negocio.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar azúcar, aceites, frijoles, maíz, entre otros. El préstamo será para fortalecer su negocio que vendrá a mejorar los ingresos de la familia y podrán cubrir de mejor manera las necesidades de sus hijos.
texts.en:
María, 42, studied up to fifth grade.  She's the single mother of three children and a homemaker, but she wants to start a business and have a store in her home.  It's in an area where a lot of people go by, a central location that would work very well for her.  Currently she has products on sale but not many, so she wants to improve her business.  

Previously she earned a living as a merchant in a store where she was paid for her services.  That's where she acquired the sales experience.  Her mother's willing to help her so she can start the business.

The loan she's requesting is to buy sugar, oil, beans, corn, and other products.  It will strengthen her business, which will improve her family's income, and they'll be able to better cover their children's needs.

loans.use: to buy sugar, oil, beans, corn, and other products to strengthen her business and improve the family's income

loans.name: Primitivo

texts.en:
Primitivo is a father who is raising his family in a rural community. He is 50 years old and has two adult-age children. Aside from being a farmer, he also operates his motorcycle transport business to gain additional income. 

Due to the high cost of commodities, he needs to increase his income to sustain the necessities of his family. To continuously operate his motorcycle, he is in need of PHP13,000 in additional capital to buy spare parts and accessories needed for maintenance. 

Through this loan, Primitivo believes that he will provide safe transportation to his passengers and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and accessories needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle

location.town: Brgy. San Juan, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana aged 46 and she is the mother of three children, living in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a General Store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap biscuits etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store as well. He speaks with a steady, even tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone; he has built up a very good relation with his customers. 

His general store is very famous in the town and that is the reason his business running well. Due to good relations his sales have increased a lot but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Shabana requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stocks of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc. 

Shabana thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her husband's general store business

loans.name: Lenchonghoi Group

texts.en:
Lenchonghoi group consist of fifteen women striving for their own economic betterment. The name of the group “Lenchonghoi” is a word that comes from the “Thadou” tribe folk-tale. She was a woman who was believed to be the most beautiful woman in the world, protected and saved by her seven younger brothers from the villain known as “Khalvompu.”  

All members are hard-working women who came together as a group to help each other through loans. Nemboichong is the featured member of the group, pictured with her hand raised. She is 26 years old with two sons and a daughter. She has two school-going children and an infant of two years. They live in a remote place which is far away from town. In order to get there, one needs to take a passenger bus and walk few kilometres from the bus stop. Her husband is a daily wage earner whose occupation is being a mason. He has been the main source of income for the family. 

Nemboichong weaves traditional shawls and wraparounds to generate more income and supplement their household needs. She weaves and at the same time looks after her infant child while her husband is away for work. She sometimes seeks help from neighbours and friends when she is very busy. She does the household chores when all family members are home and continues to weave after she has completed doing her household chores.  

Both parents work hard to provide for the family's well-being. They face financial problems when there is common illness like cough, rash, flu, or diarrhoea in the family. When the family members are sick, they need to pay for their medical treatment fees and medicine costs which has been very difficult in their household maintenance and they are short of funds. After paying for all these, her savings are gone and she no longer has money to buy yarn for her weaving. That affects the circulation of finances in the family when she cannot weave to generate income.

Fortunately, she came across WSDS where she can access loans for her business endeavour for which she is very thankful. She will buy yarn of different colours and textures to weave beautiful wraparounds and shawls to attract customers and generate more profit. She wants to start saving again by producing more products and she wishes good health for her family like every mother. She says “Good health is the most valuable thing one can have because with good health all things are possible.” She also thanks all the lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: To buy different colours and textures of yarn for weaving traditional shawls and wraparounds.

loans.name: Rosa Virginia

texts.es: Rosa de 57 años de edad posee un negocio de fotocopiadora ubicada cerca de su casa en una zona escolar desde hace 5 años, tiene muchos clientes, con su trabajo logra salir adelante con los gastos de la casa, vive con su hija en casa propia, la hija trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos como papel bond, tintas para impresoras, etc. y asi seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Rosa is 57 years old. She has had a photocopy business located in her house which is in a school zone for 5 years. She has a lot of clients and manages to get ahead with the household expenses with her work. She lives with her daughter in her own house. Her daughter works and helps her economically. Rosa is requesting a loan to buy supplies like bond paper, ink for printers, etc. so she can continue with her work which generates good profits.

loans.use: to buy paper, inks for printers, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy land in order to build his own house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soup, soap, detergent, snacks, soft drinks, toilet paper, etc.

loans.name: Andrei

texts.ru:
За счет вложения в хозяйство средств КИВА в предыдущий раз Андрей смог увеличить доход с огорода, что, в свою очередь, помогло ему оплачивать и учебу сына. 
На 15 000 гривен в этот раз Андрей хочет построить дополнительные теплицы. Дело в том, что у родителей жены Андрея был участок земли. Внезапно отец жены заболел и вскоре он умер. Поэтому после смерти тестя участок земли перешел Андрею и его семье. На этом месте Андрей теперь решил построить две новые теплицы.
texts.en: Andrei's last loan with Kiva allowed him to earn more money from farming and pay for his son's education in turn.
