This time around, he's seeking a loan of 15,000 hryvnia to build some additional greenhouses; Andrei and his family inherited some land from his wife's parents after his father-in-law fell ill and died, and he has decided to build two new greenhouses on it.

loans.use: build two new greenhouses

loans.name: Ana Mirian

texts.es: Ana de 58 años de edad posee desde hace 10 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia donde vende variedad de productos, tiene muchos clientes, con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante con los gastos de la casa, vive con su esposo en casa propia, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de sopas, jabón, detergentes, golosinas, refrescos, papel higiénico, etc. para poder tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: For ten years Ana, 58 years old, has had a small store at her place of residence where she sells a variety of products. She has many customers. With the sales she makes she is able to manage the household expenses. She lives with her husband in their own house. She is requesting a loan to buy soups, snacks, soft drinks, toilet paper, soap, detergents, etc. in order to have a higher income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soups, snacks, soft drinks, toilet paper, soap, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is a responsible mother of five children. She 29 years old and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for twenty years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. 

Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good; it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to do maintenance of his taxi. Therefore, Shameem has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Shameem's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Shameem also plans to make savings with the profit amount from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Shameem is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Ph^allang

texts.en:
Ph^Allang, who is 28 years old, is residing in Kang Meas District, Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. She has only one child who is currently in school. To make a living and support her family, Ph^Allang manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and selling the crop to the local dealers. So far, she has been in this career for nearly ten years. The net profit that she can make is around 4.00 USD per day, on average.  

Currently, Ph^Allang would like to request a Kiva loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. She would like to thank all lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is 48 years old and he lives with his family in Vanadzor city of Lori region. He is so thankful for his first Kiva loan (he paid his daughter’s tuition fee for the second semester and he also bought a computer for his children) and hopes to have a second one. He has graduated from the Agricultural Institute at Yerevan city and has a specialty in engineering as a mechanic, but for many years since he works simultaneously in two different spheres; he is a teacher at the school and a teacher of military knowledge and preparedness. Artur is married, his wife works as a saleswoman and they have two children; both his son and his daughter are already students. His daughter studies at the paid division of Vanadzor State University, the faculty of Armenian Language and Literature. 

Artur asks for a loan of 85,000 Armenian drams, since together with his saved money he will manage to pay his daughter’s tuition fee for the first semester.

loans.use: to pay his daughter’s tuition fee for the first semester

loans.name: Shumila

texts.en:
Shumila is 29 years old and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her 3 children. Her husband has been working in public sector organization for many years, he is responsible to fulfill the needs of the family. Shumila is providing sewing services and earns income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.

Shumila needs different kinds of goods such as needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. for her business. But due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also be helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profits by providing better sewing services.

Shumila is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre joven de 21 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos y su negocio es la venta de plantas de jardín.
Él es inteligente, responsable, trabajador y optimista. Su negocio lo realiza en la popular feria ’16 de julio’ los días jueves y domingo, esta feria se caracteriza por el comercio en todas las áreas.
Juan es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro corto, su lengua materna es el español y habla aymará por herencia familiar. Su negocio es la venta de plantas de jardín, él se encarga de cultivarlas para disponerlas a la venta y también compra nuevas variedades. Él estudia en la universidad el segundo año de la carrera de ingeniería ecológica, vive en casa de sus padres y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos como; luz, gas y agua. Su sueño es terminar la carrera y conseguir un buen trabajo, el desea realizar la compra de una computadora portátil para continuar con sus estudios hasta finalizarla.
Es por esos motivos que Juan solicita un préstamo para la compra de una computadora portátil y terminar su carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Juan is a young man, 21 years old, single, no children. He is intelligent, responsible, hard-working, and optimistic. His business is selling garden plants at the popular outdoor market "16 of July" which takes place every Thursday and Sunday, where all kinds of goods are sold. He grows the plants that he puts on sale, and he also buys new varieties.

Juan has tanned skin, short black hair, and is of medium height. His mother tongue is Spanish and he speaks Aymará from family legacy.  He lives at home with his parents and he has basic utility services available such as light, gas and water.

He is in his second year of studies at the university for a degree in Ecological Engineering. He dreams of graduating and getting a good job.

Juan would like to buy a laptop to continue with the studies and graduate. He is requesting the loan to buy the laptop.

loans.use: to buy a laptop to finish his career studies.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 25-year-old single man from Qabatiya, a village near Jenin city. He lives with his family in a small, simple house. His father works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income is barely enough to cover all his needs. 

Mohammad is a student in a local university where he studies Business Administration. He wants to take the B.A. degree and find a job in the future to help his family. 

Mohammad took a USD (U.S. dollar) loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to complete his studies faster and find a job. 

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester

loans.name: Lercy

texts.en:
Lercy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers for her fish-vending business.

Lercy has been in this business for two years. Lercy earns additional income from food vending and farming vegetables.

Lercy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is 40 years old and  lives in the village of Getahovit in the Tavush region. She lives with her parents-in-law and her two sons. Her husband went to the Russian Federation for work but did not return, so the care of the family and all its needs are the responsibility of Svetlana alone. She works at a private company and is involved in farming and agriculture. On her farm she has two pigs, two beehives and fifty chickens. She sells eggs, meat, honey, apples, persimmons and figs. She does all of this with a great sense of duty and devotion, since there is nobody whom she can rely on.

Svetlana is requesting a loan of 400,000 AMD to buy wheat for autumn sowing activities and to buy animal fodder in preparation for the winter months.

loans.use: to buy wheat for autumn sowing activities and also to buy animal fodder

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 50 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Monica is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Monica has been in pig fattening for five years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lusi

texts.en:
Meet Lusi. Lusi is married and she lives with her husband and their only child in Cianjur, a city located at the foot of Mount Gede-Pangrango, West Java. 

To support her family living, Lusi runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime for her customers. Lusi joined Ruma about a month ago because she wanted to increase her family’s income. She feels really excited to expand her new business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. 

As the business runs, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide access to mobile services for her community by processing airtime transactions on the weekends. Lusi thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in her community.

loans.name: Parvina

texts.en:
Parvina was born in 1993. She is married. Her husband is a seller. Parvina is a student of the first course at Technical University of Tajikistan. Parvina learns world economy. She studies well. Parvina studies full-time. 

She needs financial support because her husband does not have money to pay for her university tuition. Parvina is asking for a loan to pay for tuition. She awaits your support and thanks you in advance for your help.

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Leonarda is 51 years old, and both of her children are in school.

Leonarda has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Leonarda requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials and gear for her business.

Leonarda has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Leonarda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for her business

loans.name: Juhaeni

texts.en:
Meet Juhaeni. Juhaeni is married and she lives with her husband and their two children in the southern part of Serang, a city located about three hours' drive from Jakarta, the capital city. 

To support her family living, Juhaeni runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, daily consumption products, and mobile phone airtime for her customers.

Juhaeni joined Ruma about two months ago because she wanted to increase her family’s income. She feels really excited to expand her new business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. 

As the business runs, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide access to mobile services for her community by processing airtime transactions on the weekends. 

In the photo, Juhaeni is in her small stall. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in her community.

loans.name: Zuhra

texts.en:
Zuhra is a 41-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her spouse and four children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for many years. He is solely responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family.

Zuhra's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories such as pieces of cloth, needles and sewing machine accessories. But due to some financial constraints, he is not in suitable condition to buy these items for his business purpose. 

Therefore, Zuhra has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount, she will financially assist her husband to obtain these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that he can earn a more profitable income.

For this financial assistance Zuhra is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband buy tailoring accessories for his business.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora works hard to support her family. Flora is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Flora requested a PHP 30,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Flora has been in this business for three years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.es: Glenda, tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 5 hijos, vive en una aldea de Morazán, Yoro junto a sus hijos. Siempre se ha dedicado al negocio para obtener ingresos y sostener a su familia. Lleva 15 años elaborando comidas para vender como son almuerzos, pan y tamales. Las ventas las realiza en su casa y de manera ambulante o entrega a domicilio principalmente el pan y tamales. Ya ha obtenido varios prestamos con la institución para mantener el negocio y actualmente solicita otro por 15,000 lempiras, para comprar insumos como carnes, condimentos, vegetales, harina de maíz, arroz, frijoles, manteca, huevos etc. para elaborar tamales, comidas y pan para vender. Su plan es lograr conseguir una glorieta donde poner mejor el negocio de comidas y lograr mejores ingresos para darles mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en: Glenda is 39 years old. She is a single mother of 5 children who lives in the village of Morazán, Yoro with her children. She has always worked in business in order to get income and sustain her family. She has been making meals to sell like lunch, bread and tamales for 15 years. She makes her sales at her house or in the streets or home delivery mainly for bread and tamales. She has had a number of loans with the institution in order to maintain her business and currently she is requesting another for 15,000 HNL. She will buy supplies like meat, spices, vegetables, corn flour, beans, lard, eggs etc. to make tamales, meals and bread to sell. Her plan is to get a stand to put her food business and create greater income to provide a better life for her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies like meat, spices, vegetables, corn flour, beans, lard, eggs etc.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 54 years old and married. She has six children.

Lolita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 24 years and also earns an income from raising livestock. 

Lolita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, detergent soap, cooking oil, sugar, cereals, etc. to sell.

Lolita has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan.

Lolita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, detergent soap, cooking oil, sugar, cereals, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Valerik

texts.en:
Valerik is 42 years old and he lives in Sevan city of the Gegharkunik region. He lives with his daughter, who is a student. 

Valerik worked for several years as a rescuer, then he worked at the petrol station and now he works at a gas station. As he says, it is very hard alone to take care of his daughter, especially since she is a student, which means a lot of expenses nearly every day. So Valerik does not want to spend even a little money on his own needs.

So Valerik asks a loan of 350,000 Armenian drams to undergo a course of dental treatment, since the dentist directed an immediate treatment with a period of a month.

loans.use: to undergo a course of dental treatment.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge de 39 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida en casa propia, desde hace 5 años se dedica a la artesanía elabora una variedad de artículos para el hogar así como muestra en la fotografía, vende en los diferentes pueblos aledaños y tiene clientes fijos, Jorge esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de pintura de diferentes colores, moldes, pinceles, barniz, etc. para poder continuar con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Jorge, 39, lives with his life partner in his own house.

He has earned a living making arts and crafts for five years.  He makes a variety of household items, as the photograph shows.  He sells in various nearby towns and has steady customers.

Jorge's requesting a loan to buy different colors of paint, molds, brushes, varnish, etc., so he can continue working and earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy different colors of paint, molds, brushes, varnish, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a compressor.

loans.name: Jahanatou

texts.fr: Jahanatou jeune femme de 32ans est mariée à un revendeur. Ils ont en charge 02 enfants de 8 et 5ans qui sont scolarisés. Pour aider son conjoint dans les charges familiales, elle revend depuis 2002 des pagnes et objets plastiques dans sa boutique. Elle espère augmenter les stocks pour remplir sa boutique et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en: Jahanatou, a married 32-year-old woman, works as a vendor. She and her husband have two children living in their care, aged five and eight years old, who are both receiving an education. In order to assist her partner with the household expenses, she has been selling pagne cloth and plastic objects from her stall since 2002. With this loan, she hopes to be able to increase her stock and meet her family's expenses.

loans.use: to purchase traditional pagne cloth and plastic objects

loans.name: Hilolby

texts.en:
Hilolby is the single mother of two children who are adults. Through her own initiative, she opened a café 12 years ago. Her cafe has now grown. She cooks pies, patties, etc. She lives in the capital of Tajikistan with her family, and is a very enterprising and innovative person who is always trying to improve her business. She works every day at her cafe and believes that it is going well because of her dedication and the excellent service she provides to her customers.

Her greatest dream is to be able to see her children become fine professionals. That is why she always strives to provide them with a better education. 

Hilolby intends to use the loan to buy food items for her cafe. She will buy groceries, soft drinks, mineral water and other items. She is grateful to the Kiva lenders for their generosity, because thanks to this, she will help her family get ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy food items for increasing her cafe's working capital

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 28 years old and single.

Maricel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Maricel has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport and raising pigs.

Maricel aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 32 years old and married. She has three children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Arlene has been raising livestock for three years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

Arlene is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 46 years old and married, with eight children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Vilma is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs.

Vilma has been in pig fattening for six years and also earns additional income from a general store and farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Varsham

texts.en:
Varsham is 20 years old and he lives in Yerevan city. He is a student and he studies at the Yerevan State Institute of Physical Culture and he is a future pedagogue-trainer. Now he lives alone. He was born in Vanadzor city, but he decided to have his education in Yerevan city, with great plans of good a future and a useful profession. It is perfect to notice that he manages that. 

Simultaneously with his education, he also works at the sports school in Yerevan city as a cycling trainer. This young man seriously decided to work only at his profession, since in this field there is really a lack of specialists. 

Varsham has a car of his own, which helps him to be on time both at the Institute and at his works place. He asks this loan since his car needs some repairing and it is a very important vehicle for his everyday life.

loans.use: to repair his car.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Milagros is 64 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Milagros has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Milagros requested a 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fabric, threads, needles, etc., for her business.

Milagros has been in this business for 47 years. Milagros would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fabric, threads, needles, etc., for her business

loans.name: Jyotsna

texts.en:
Jyotsna is a young and energetic entrepreneur from Maynaguri. She is 28 years old, and she is married with two children (one son and one daughter). Unfortunately, she did not get an opportunity for study in her childhood due to her family's financial problem. She is uneducated and can sign her name only. So, she is determined to provide her children with proper education. Her children are attending school. They live in their own house in a village, Tekatuli, in Jalpaiguri district.

Jyotsna's husband is engaged in vegetable cultivation on their own land, but his income is not enough to support his own family. That is why Jyotsna is rearing cattle to supplement the household income. She started with the purchase of one dairy cow, and now she has two milking cows in her herd. Her dedication and hard work established her as a successful entrepreneur. She supplies milk to her neighbors and local tea shops.  

Jyotsna's husband, 40-year-old Suresh, actively helps her around the house, as well as with the milk production. With the goal of increasing their business, Jyotsna has turned to BJS (Kiva's field partner) to buy one dairy cow so she can increase her milk production, as well as satisfy her customers’ demand. The income from this loan will allow her to increase her business, improve her family's living standard, and to provide her children with better education.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy one cow for growing her milk selling business.

loans.name: Atin

texts.en:
Meet Atin. Atin lives with her husband and their four children in East Bandung, a rural area located in West Java. 

Atin runs a small stall that sells mobile phone airtime for her customers. Atin was introduced to Ruma by one of her friends and she quickly became interested to join Ruma about eight months ago because she wanted to increase her family’s income. She is excited about her new business, which is selling mobile phone airtime to her community. 

As the business runs, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide access to mobile services for her community by processing airtime transactions on the weekends. In the photo, Atin is in her small stall. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in her community.

loans.name: Alpana

texts.en:
Fifty-two-year-old Alpana hails from Maynaguri. She is married to Subrata, 52 years old, who does a very nominal job in a private farm. Both have higher secondary education. She lives with her husband and two sons in a small village at Maynaguri, Jalpaiguri. Both her sons were deprived of education, so they did not expect any respectable job, and now they are working laborers on a daily wage basis.

The job which Alpana's husband does offers a very meager income, and her sons have no consistent income. To give the family financial assistance, Alpana is engaged in a garment selling business. Alpana sells clothes and saris in her house. She purchases from the wholesalers and resells to the people of her locality. 

The assortment of goods she sells is not that big and needs to be updated and expanded periodically in order for her small business to be productive and compatible. Alpana currently needs a loan to buy new clothes to resell to her customers.

She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and BJS. The loan she asks for is very important for her to purchase a new stock of clothing. She hopes it will generate more income to give financial sustenance to her family and to help her become successful in her business.

She is grateful to her lenders, BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase various clothing to sell.

loans.name: Nuriniso

texts.en:
Nuriniso is a hardworking business lady from Tajikistan. She lives there with her husband, two sons and daughter-in-law. Her elder son is a student.

Nuriniso has a clothing sales business. She sells men's clothes, underwear, socks, etc. Nuriniso is a very hardworking woman and has a very good attitude towards her customers. She has been busy with this business for some years. 

Nuriniso every season renews the assortment of her goods because the business struggle is big in the local market. She is asking for a loan of 7,500 TJS to buy men's clothes for the new season. 

Nuriniso hopes for the support and trust of her lenders.

loans.use: To buy clothes for the new season.

loans.name: Rosa Amalia

texts.es:
ROSA AMALIA TIENE 55 AÑOS DE EDAD, SU ESTADO CIIL ES CASADA, VIVE EN CASA PROPIA JUNTO A SU ESPOSO E HIJO. SU FAMILIA ES MUY UNIDA. VIVE EN UNA COMUNIDAD DEDICADA AL COMERCIO, AGRICULTURA Y GANADERIA; UBICADA EN EL DISTRIRO DE CAYALTI, PROVINCIA DE CHICLAYO, REGIÓN LAMBAYEQUE, COSTA NORTE DE PERÚ.

ROSA AMALIA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA A LA CRIANZA Y VENTA DE ANIMALES DE CORRAL, ANIMALES COMO PATOS Y POLLOS. ADEMÁS TAMBIÉN SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ARTICULOS PARA EL HOGAR, PRODUCTOS COMO CUADROS PARA PARED, ADORNOS, ENTRE OTROS; Y EVENTUALMENTE PREPARA ALIMENTOS PARA LA VENTA DE CLIENTES AL PASO. ELLA DESEA EL PRÉSTAMO PARA INVERTIRLO EN PUESTA DE CALAMINA Y ACABADOS EN INTERIOR DE CASA, ASÍ SE MEJORARÁ SU SEGURIDAD Y COMODIDAD DE SU HOGAR PARA ELLA Y TODA SU FAMILIA, MEJORANDO DE ESTA FORMA SU CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Rosa Amalia is 55, married and lives in her own house with her husband and son. They are a tight knit family. She lives in a town whose economy is based on retail, agriculture and livestock. She lives in Cayaltí, Chiclayo, Perú.

Rosa works raising and selling livestock like ducks and chickens. She also sells home furnishings like picture frames, decorations and so on. Eventually she would like to prepare food to sell to passers by. A loan will help her to invest in corrugated iron and home furnishings, and in doing so improve security and comfort in her home and improve quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to invest in corrugated iron and home furnishings.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita, 58, is a married woman with nine children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Bernardita has a direct-selling Personal Collection products business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years.  

Bernardita requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more products from Personal Collection to sell to her customers.

In the future, Bernardita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Hasbuni

texts.en:
Meet Hasbuni. Hasbuni is married.  He lives with his wife and their two children in the eastern part of Serang, a suburban area located about 3 hours' drive from Jakarta. 

To support his family, Hasbuni works as a temporary worker in smaller local companies. He also runs a small kiosk in front of his house which sells mobile phone airtime. 

Hasbuni joined Ruma about three months ago because he wanted to increase his family’s income. He feels really excited to expand his new business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. As the business continues, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide access to mobile services for his community by processing airtime transactions on the weekends. 

Hasbuni thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in his community

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia is 29 years old. She is married and lives with her husband Ucha in the small village named Zovreti. The family is actively involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have two cows and a calf. Maia milks the cows every day and produces dairy products to sell. In addition, they have a plot of agricultural land, where they grow maize and nut trees. Maia and Ucha are very hardworking and they do their best to ensure a good harvest and generate good income. 

As the income is only seasonal, Maia decided to start her own stable business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2,000 GEL to start a trading business.

Maia will purchase clothes with the received credit, and she will start the trading business. This will give her a chance to have a stable income.

loans.use: to begin a trade in clothes.

loans.name: Ailene

texts.en:
Ailene is 31 years old and married with two children.

Ailene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items, such as canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, cooking oil, shampoo, etc., to sell.

Ailene has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables and raising pigs.

Ailene aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items, such as canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, cooking oil, shampoo, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Dolores is 41 years old and has two children who are in school.

Dolores has a candle making business in the Philippines. Dolores requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more materials like wax, cord, and other inputs for her business.

Dolores has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Dolores would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like wax and cord for her candle making business

loans.name: Anima

texts.en:
Anima, 46 years old, is a married woman and a mother of three children (two sons and one daughter). Two of them are students; one is in grade 12, and one is in the second year in college. Her husband, Mantu, is a day laborer. She lives with her family in a small village, Khagrabari, in the district of Jalpaiguri, West Bengal. Anima's eldest son also works on a daily wage basis. Both her husband and son have inconsistent income that is barely enough for a family of five members in which two are students. 

To make the family financially strong, Anima rears cattle. She keeps a dairy cow to provide milk to sell in her locality for additional income. She sells the milk in her village with the help of her husband. Every morning, she takes the cow to graze in the fields and returns by noon. Then she cooks for her family. She resumes taking care of her cow by feeding it at home. In this way, she is earning to control her cash flow, which is not sufficient to manage her daily activities. She wants to purchase one more cow.

She is seeking a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS, which provides financial help to rural needy women to start new businesses. With the loan, the cow acquired will provide Anima with an additional quantity of milk. The extra milk produced will be sold to neighbors and at the local market for profit. Income generated from her business will enable Anima to pay the educational costs of her children and keep improving the quality of life that she is leading presently. 

She is thankful to both BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: to buy a cow for her dairy business.

loans.name: Sharifamo

texts.en:
Sharifamo is 48 years old and lives in her own house with her family. She makes clothes for a living, and she works from home. She sews national clothes, so European style dresses. Her work is of a good quality, which is why many people come to her. 

She has worked in this field for 20 years and has a lot of experience, as well as loyal customers who keep coming back to her. 

She has decided to request a loan from IMON International in order to invest in her small business and buy key supplies, such as fabric, thread, elastic, needles, and so on, to make clothing and to generate more income.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, elastic, needles, and so on, to make clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertiliser for his cocoa plants.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a young and enterprising woman of 26 years from the small village, Khagrabari, in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is married and a mother of two children (one son and one daughter), one of whom is a student of grade 3; the other is an infant. She and her husband, Narayan, both attended school up to grade 6, and had to give up for their families’ poor economy. Her husband has a business of selling timber at Khagrabari, which is a deep rural village.

Anita has been practicing cattle farming for several years to give sustenance to her family through dairy. She finds dairy farming enjoyable and profitable. She has a dairy cow. She supplies milk from door to door to her neighbors. In order to increase her business, she needs to purchase one more cow. But, the biggest challenge she faces is limited funds.

Anita is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow. It will produce enough milk to enable her to supply more and satisfy her customers; thus earn more profit. So, she has taken a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS.  

She dreams to purchase more cows in the future to enlarge her business in order to provide higher education to her children. She gives her heartiest thanks to her lenders, BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for her milk selling business.

loans.name: Bahari Group

texts.en:
Janeth, who is in her early forties, is married with three children who are still in school. She has been a food vendor for four years now. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Janeth's seventh loan from Tujijenge, Tanzania. She used the previous loans to keep on increasing the stock of her mamalishe (food sales business), and the business is now big and serves many customers. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan process. She used the profit to pay for school fees and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy the out of stock items in her food store and to start selling sodas and water. She dreams of building her own house.

Janeth will share this loan with her loan group Bahari, which has six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buythe out of stock items in her food store and to start selling sodas and water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase the inventory in her grocery store

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a 25-year-old married woman from Qabatiya, a village near Jenin City. She is a mother of two sons and two daughters. Lina and her husband have agricultural land which they plant with olive trees and other seasonal crops. It is a good business, and they both cooperate together in it.

Lina took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more olive seedlings for their agricultural land. By taking this loan, Lina will be able to increase productivity and also their income.

Lina appears in the photo on the family farm.

loans.use: to buy more olive seedlings for her family's agricultural land.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 29 years old, a resident of  Kyenjojo, Uganda, and a father of two children . He is a hardworking man and a cattle trader. He buys cattle and fattens it to mature faster for the expanding market. He earns extra income from banana planting and sales. 

Michael has dreams of educating his children and penetrating urban markets for his business; however, he is faced with limited capital and transport to serve different market segments. Michael wants a loan to buy more cattle for sale.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for sale.

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy works hard to support her family. Cristy is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines.

Cristy requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials and gear for her fishing business.

Cristy has been in this business for two years now.

Cristy would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for her fishing business

loans.name: Hafeth

texts.en:
Hafeth is a 25-year-old single young man from Qabatiya, a village near Jenin City. He lives with his parents in a small house. His family has an agricultural land where they plants olive trees. Hafeth started working in a band five years ago. He sings and play the keyboard for several social events like weddings. It is a good business, and Hafeth is a very talented guy.

Hafeth took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new keyboard for his business. By taking this loan, Hafeth will be able to improve his business and increase demand.

Hafeth appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new keyboard for his business

loans.name: Flor De Ita Cora Group

texts.es:
Flor de Ita Cora se formo con la unión de varias vecinas y amigas de la ciudad de Pilar,  están en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, a través del cual podrán conocer la situación de cada una. 
La Sra. Ramona se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza, pero igualmente está consciente de que este trabajo y esfuerzo que está haciendo debe ser continuo y permanente. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que tiene un almacén, tiene todo tipo de productos, con el que surte a las personas de su barrio, está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder superar la pobreza e ir mejorando día a día.
La Sra. Ramona solicita de este préstamo para la compra  de  productos como harina, carne, verduras, fideos, aceite, azúcar, nafta, etc. para luego vender a los clientes, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Flor de Ita Cora group formed when neighbors and friends in the city of Pilar joined together.  They are in their second loan cycle with the women's committee and are participating in the poverty elimination survey, which allows them to know the condition of each member.  

Ramona is improving her condition of poverty and is equally aware that the work and effort she is putting in should be continuous and permanent.  She has a store that sells all types of products that her neighbors need.  She is putting in her best effort to be able to overcome poverty and she is improving day by day.

Ramona is requesting this loan to purchase products like flour, meat, vegetables, pasta, oil, sugar, and gas to sell to her customers.  This will help her have a stable plan for her business, which will help to improve her profits.

loans.use: to purchase products like flour, meat, vegetables, pasta, oil, sugar, and gas to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es:
El canto de las aves, los rayos del sol asomándose por la ventana y el olor a café recién hecho es el despertador mañanero de Feliciano, quien desde tempranas horas sale a darle mantenimiento a sus tierras. La agricultura y la ganadería es la herencia que le dejaron sus padres, Feliciano de 61 años es un padre responsable, honrado y trabajador, siempre  se ha esforzado en llevar el alimento a su hogar. El apoyo de sus tres hijos ha sido esencial para la producción de la agricultura de sus tierras y de esa manera quiere ampliar su producción para poder trabajar directamente con los exportadores quienes brindan mejores ofertas que los comerciantes de la zona que no pagan el verdadero valor de los productos.
Con anhelos de incrementar su producción y obtener más ingresos en su familia Feliciano solicita un crédito para realizar la compra de 8klg de refrescante, 4 litros de carbendacin, 10 litro de gramoxon y abono. Deposita su confianza en el crédito para que le facilite  todos estos productos que  ayudaran a mejorar e incrementar la producción y de esa manera mantener a su ganado saludable y sus tierras bien cuidadas.  Como metas a futuro Feliciano espera  obtener ganancias y de esa manera ayudar a sus hijos y poder comprar más tierras,  terminar con éxito su siembra y culminar de pagar el préstamo.
texts.en:
The song of the birds, the sun’s rays beginning to come through the window, and the smell of just made coffee are Feliciano’s morning alarm clock.  He leaves in the early hours to provide maintenance to his fields.  Agriculture and livestock are the inheritance left to him from his parents.

Feliciano, age 61, is a responsible father.  He is honest and hard-working.  He has always put forth much effort to provide food for his household.  The support of his three children has been essential to the agriculture production of his land.  This is the way he wants to expand his production in order to be able to work directly with the exporters.  They provide better offers than the merchants in the area who do not pay the true value of the products.

He is eager to increase his production and to get more earnings for his family.  That is why Feliciano is requesting a loan to buy eight kilograms of refresher, four liters of fungicide, ten liters of herbicide, and fertilizer.

He will use the loan to buy all of these products, and he trusts that they will help him improve and increase the production.  This way he will keep his livestock healthy and his land well kept.

As goals for the future, Feliciano hopes to get earnings and help his children this way, to buy more land, to successfully finish planting, and to finish paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy eight kilograms of refresher, four liters of fungicide, ten liters of herbicide, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Santos Sofia

texts.es: Doña santos de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, ella se dedica a la venta panes con pollo y tamales dese hace 20 años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene mucha clientela, Doña Santos esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz, verduras, pollos, tomates, panes y demás ingredientes para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Santos is 56 years old and lives in a house she owns with her husband and their four children.  She has worked selling bread with chicken and tamales for 20 years.  Her business is located in her home and she has many customers.

Santos is requesting this loan to purchase corn, vegetables, chickens, tomatoes, bread, and other ingredients so she can continue with her sales and improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase corn, vegetables, chickens, tomatoes, bread, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soups, bread, candy, soft drinks, basic grains, and eggs, etc.

loans.name: Chap's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chap, born in 1970, is a Thai ethnic person. She currently is living with her husband and her two children in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Mrs. Chap’s family has a small garden for plants and a small farm for raising pigs for meat. Her family’s annual income is just enough for food and covering her two children’s education fees. Now, the married couple wants to borrow a loan from M7-MFI to open a cow breeding model with the hope to improve her family’s living standard and escape from poverty.

She very much hopes that this loan will help her accomplish a successful cow breeding model, her family life will be improved, and her children will have good conditions for learning and become useful citizens of the society.

loans.use: to open a cow breeding model.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Danaya vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 45 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village Siguila de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de restauration et de condiment. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  13eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Neh (la 2eme  femme debout  de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de galette  à base de sauce dans le village et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs de grains de riz à Siguila et à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit au marché et à la maison à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Neh  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 18 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petites dépenses familiales  et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The four women of the Danaya Group all live within traditional family frameworks. Each member is 45 years old on average with an average of five children each. They all live in the village of Siguila in Ségou, the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

They know each other through the bonds of community, family, marriage and their revenue-generating activities in the village. They all run their own food stalls or sell foodstuffs. In order to increase their business assets, the group members decided to collaborate alongside Soro Yiriwaso. This will be their thirteenth group loan.

Neh (the woman standing second from the right in the photo) is a well-known food vendor within the village and its surrounding areas. She plans on using this loan to purchase two sacks of rice in Siguila. She then sells these goods in exchange for cash, and often for credit, at market and also out of her own home to a mixed customer base.

With this loan, Neh hopes to make an average monthly profit of 18,000 FCFA, which will be used to pay for her family's expenses and also to increase her business funds. She hopes to further continue this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to purchase rice

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace 10 años a la agricultura (siembra maíz), vende sus productos en las agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, el joven está solicitando un crédito para comprar semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo ya que es es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: The young man whose face has been pixelated because he is 28 years old and lives in a high risk area, has been making a living for the last 10 years in agriculture (he sows corn). He sells his products in basic grains buying and selling agencies; he lives in his own house with his two children. The young man is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilisers, manure, plague controlling products etc, and to improve the land shown in the photograph in order to continue with his work, as it is his only source of income.

loans.use: comprar semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno

loans.name: Jose De La Paz

texts.es: Jose tiene 62 años de edad  y vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hija, el se dedica a la elaboración y venta de hamacas desde hace 17 años, comercializa en todos los mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, Don Jose esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos de colores por mayor para seguir con su trabajo y asi poder tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en: Jose is 62 years old and lives in his own house with his life partner and his daughter. He has been making a living for the last 17 years making and selling hammocks; he sells in the markets near his house. Don Jose is asking for a loan to bulk buy coloured thread, in order to continue his work and therefore have better income, as well as a better quality of life together with his family.

loans.use: to bulk buy coloured thread.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita has been engaged in a cattle-breeding business for the last five years. She is a rural married woman of 28 years, hailing from Maynaguri. Anita is a mother of one son. Both Anita and her husband Manik studied up to grade 9. Together with her husband, Anita keeps a cow and three goats. She milks the cow and produces curd, butter, and paneer (cottage cheese), while her husband sells the products at the local market.

This is the sole income for the family. This is why Anita and her husband work hard to have a stable income and cover their family's daily costs. Anita's husband also owns a plot of agricultural land where he grows different types of vegetables such as potatoes, beans, gourds, and other seasonal vegetables, which are sold in the market.

Now, in order to expand her dairy business, Anita is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva's field partner). By applying for this loan, Anita wants to purchase a cow and forage for feeding the livestock. This is very important for her to enlarge the production of dairy products and gather more income for the family. She dreams of having a big farm and works hard to make her dream come true.

She is grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for selling milk and milk products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sand, brick, cement, iron, laminated sheeting etc to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a 33-year-old illiterate woman, hailing from Maynaguri. She is married and a mother of three children (one son and two daughters) who attend school and are in grades 11, 8, and 5 respectively. She lives with her husband and children in the village of Tekatuli in Jalpaiguri district, West Bengal.

She is a housewife who takes care of her family and manages the household work. Her husband is a scrap dealer by profession. He purchases scrap iron, plastic accessories, aluminum, and copper from the retailers or hawkers and sells it to recycling factories. He has been doing the same business for many years and earns a reasonable profit for his family. He loves his children a lot and wants to provide them better facilities and education. He wants to earn the maximum income to ensure and secure the better future of his children. So, he wants to buy scrap materials in large quantity.

Therefore, Anita has requested a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) for her husband so he can be able to buy scrap material.

Anita hopes that this loan will enhance her husband’s earning capacity. In this way, he would be able to make savings more than earlier. Anita wants her children to get a better education.

Anita seems very glad after receiving this loan, and thanks Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: to buy scrap goods for resale.

loans.name: Juana Rosa

texts.es:
Juana Rosa vive con 2 hijos menores, en casa propia. Aproximadamente desde hace más de 20 años, cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales. Su familia es muy unida. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia; ubicada en el distrito de Lagunas, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Juana Rosa se dedica al servicio de peluquería en local propio (parte de su casa) en el distrito de Lagunas Nuevo - Mocupe, desde hace más de 10 años aproximadamente. El destino del préstamo es para la compra de herramientas para la peluquería (maquina laseadora, rizadora, tenasa, entre otros), lo que le permitirá darle un valor agregado a su servicio permitiendole de esta forma captar mayores clientes, mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende una mejora en su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Juana Rosa lives in her own house with her two minor children.  For over 20 years she has had good personal and work references.  Her family is very united.  She lives in a community that works in commerce, agriculture, and with livestock.  It is located in the Lagunas district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, in the northern highlands of Peru.

Juana Rosa provides hairdressing service at her own place (part of her house) in the Lagunas Nuevo – Mocupe district.  She has been doing this for over ten years.

She will use the loan to buy hairdressing tools (flat iron, curling irons, and others).  This will allow her to add an extra value to her service.  This way she will get more customers, greater income, and better profits.  The result will be a better quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy hairdressing tools (flat iron, curling irons, and others).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for medical treatment and medicine.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le h pixeleado la cara por tener 23 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto  riesgo, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de hamacas desde hace 4 años, comercializa sus productos en todos los pueblos aledaños, la joven vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos, ella  solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos de colores por mayor para seguir con su trabajo y asi poder tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en:
The young woman’s face has been pixelated in the photo because she is 23 years old and lives in a high-risk zone.  She has been making and selling hammocks for four years, commercializing her products in all the neighboring towns. 

She lives in her own house with her life partner and their three children. She is requesting this loan to buy colored thread in bulk so she can continue working to obtain better income and a have a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to buy colored thread in bulk to make hammocks.

loans.name: Gita

texts.en:
Gita is a 33-year-old married woman and the mother of three children (two sons and one daughter). She is from a small village of Maynaguri in Jalpaiguri district. She is an uneducated woman who can sign her name only, but provides education to all her children, though with great difficulty. They live in South Khagrabari in Jalpaiguri district. Her children are in different grades in secondary school.

Her husband, 44-year-old Dhiren, is a mason by profession, engaged with a shuttering business of centering work on houses. Centering is a type of framework where the temporary structure upon which the stones of an arch or vault are laid during construction.

Gita is a housewife who always supports her family and her husband. She is active and energetic. She wants to go ahead and get over all the financial hurdles. They need to expand the business in order to strengthen their economic condition. Now, her husband wants to buy some tools and wood for his business. Gita has decided to help her husband and take a loan to purchase materials for the business.

So, she has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). With the help of the loan, her husband will be able to buy wood and necessary tools to prepare foundations for many houses. With the profit, she hopes to enhance her husband’s business and earn more, which will increase her family’s financial status. She wants to save money to give higher education to her children.

Gita and her husband are thanking BJS and Kiva for supporting them financially.

loans.use: to purchase tools and materials for her husband's shuttering business.

loans.name: Carlos Ivan

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre soltero, siempre dedicado a su familia, muy amable y responsable, vive en Ica junto a sus seres queridos. Actualmente se dedica a trabajar como Vigilante en una empresa de su ciudad, cree que le está yendo bien por su constancia, dedicación y gran trabajo. En sus tiempos libres le gusta escuchar música, ver televisión, principalmente películas de acción y comedia.
Carlos tiene muchas ganas de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia es por ello que utilizará el crédito para poder comprar una cocina nueva para su casa, con esto su mamá podrá cocinar en mejores condiciones y con mayor seguridad. Carlos está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, esto ayudará a brindar bienestar a toda su familia y el continuará trabajando con mayor tranquilidad.
texts.en:
Carlos is a single, friendly and responsible man who is always dedicated to his family. He lives in Ica with his loved ones. Right now he works as a security guard for a company in Ica, and thinks that he is doing well out of his dedication, commitment and hard work. In his free time he likes listening to music and watching television - mainly action and comedy films.

Carlos has a strong desire to improve his family's quality of life and so a loan will help him to buy a new kitchen for his house, so that his mother will be able to cook more safely and in better conditions. Carlos is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their generosity which will help him to carry on working safe in the knowledge that he has improved his family's wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy a newer, safer kitchen for his mother.

loans.name: Wisam

texts.en:
Wisam is 27 years old and single. He is from Deir El Balah where he lives with his parents in a small, simple house. He works in the public sector where he earns a low income. Wisam would like to improve the family's living conditions so he decided to start working on a rickshaw. He will transfer goods to local traders. 

Wisam requested a loan from FATEN, which he will use to buy a new rickshaw for his work. With this loan, he will be able to start a new job and increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase a new rickshaw

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita tiene 45 años de edad, su estado civil es Conviviente, tiene un hijo a su cargo; vive en casa propia de material rustico en el Caserio de la Bocana del distrito de La Matanza, es un lugar donde sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio; cuenta con servicios básicos como son agua y luz. Dicha caserio está ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que desarrolla Felicita es la venta de abarrotes por menor (productos de primera necesidad: arroz, azúar, aceite, entre otros.) en su domicilio, contando ya con clientela fija por lo que tiene experiencia en el rubro, siendo conocida en la zona.

El destino del crédito es para cinvertir en la compra de mercadería para su tienda, para poder aumentar y surtir su stock de productos, tales como arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros. La inversión le ayudará a obtener mejores ingresos, mayores ganancias y por ende una mejora en su calidad de vida ya que el mercado presenta buenas perspectivas debido a que los pobladores de la zona estan trabajando en empresas exportadoras de banano, y otros trabajando como peones agricolas por temporada de cosecha de arroz.
texts.en:
Felicita is 45 years old. Her marital status is "common-law marriage," and she has one son in her care. She lives in their own house made of rustic materials in the La Bocana rural community in the La Matanza district. It's a place where the residents work in farming, livestock production, and commerce. They have basic services like running water and electricity. This rural community is located in the Morropón province, in the Piura region of Peru's northern coast.

The business activity that Felicita runs is the retail sale of groceries (basic necessities like rice, sugar, oil, and more) in her house. She already has a regular clientele, as she has experience in the field and is known in the area.

This loan is destined to be invested in the purchase of merchandise—such as rice, sugar, oil, and more—for Felicita's shop so that she can expand and stock her product inventory. This investment will help her to obtain better revenues, greater profits, and thus an improvement in her quality of life, as the market is presenting good prospects because area residents are working for banana export companies or as farm laborers during the rice harvest.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of merchandise for her shop, in order to expand and stock her product inventory.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a raising pigs business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years. She earns additional income from farming vegetables. 

Cornelia requested a loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP,  which she will use to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 51-year-old married woman with eight children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She is a very hardworking woman based in a rural area dealing in the cattle trade as her main source of income. She has been in the business for eight years, and she earns additional income from farming. 

Jane began the business in order to generate income to educate her children and build a permanent home. She mainly faces a challenge of price fluctuations for her cattle. The purpose of the loan is to buy more cattle to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to sell.

loans.name: Saviour

texts.en:
Saviour is a married man with six children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a hardworking man who deals in the buying and selling of maize, nuts, millet, and beans. He earns additional income from his salary, as he is a primary teacher. 

Saviour began his business in order to meet his family's needs, but with a limiting factor of capital. The purpose of the loan is to purchase maize and beans for sale.

loans.use: to purchase maize and beans for sale

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina is 35 years old and married. She runs a school. She began her career in education by starting a tuition academy in her house because she realized that there was a need for a good school in the community. Students who attended her evening classes and their parents encouraged her to start a school, which is what she did. She is determined to provide these deserving children with quality education, even going as far as providing free books to students who cannot afford to buy them. 

Zarina requested a loan for 100,000 PKR, which she will use to buy furniture for her school and to do some repair work to improve the school building and environment.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her school and to do necessary repair work

loans.name: Aparna

texts.en:
Aparna is 27 years old. She has a secondary education (10th grade). She wanted to go for higher studies, but it was too difficult because of her parents' economic situation. She is married now. Her husband Hemendranath, age 39, is engaged in agricultural activities. She is the mother of two sons, one of whom is in school. The younger son is not in school yet. They live in a remote region in Jalpaiguri district.

Her husband has an agricultural farm where he grows different vegetables in different seasons. He is visionary and focused. He has been in this business for the last ten years. He struggles hard to grow good-quality vegetables to satisfy his customers, but his earning is not as much as he expects. His land is very fertile and productive. So, he has decided to cultivate bitter gourd on the farmland. The main obstacle is capital.

Aparna is also a very hardworking and enterprising lady. Though she is a housewife, she helps her husband a lot in his work. Now she is seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase agricultural supplies such as bitter gourd seeds, manure, etc. She hopes the business will be a lucrative one, as bitter gourd is in very good demand in the market. So, they have chosen this crop to cultivate.

Her goals are to strengthen their family business and economy and provide a better education to her sons in renowned schools.

She thanks her lenders for helping them financially.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for bitter gourd cultivation.

loans.name: Imran

texts.en:
Imran has been running a school since 2012. Because of his dedication and hard work, in the short time since starting his school, Imran has managed to enroll 182 students, half of whom are girls. 

Imran requested a loan for 100,000 PKR, which he will use to construct two new classrooms. The new classrooms will allow him to enroll more students and further increase his business revenue. Imran is always searching for new ways to improve the school. He takes great pride in his school's reputation of providing a quality education to children of his community. He believes that effective planning and hard work are the keys to his success.

loans.use: to construct two new classrooms to enroll more students

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is married with 3 children and lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He deals in the buying and selling of maize, millet, and beans. 

Kenneth earns other income from rearing cattle and growing maize. He began his business in order to improve his standard of living and to buy a motorcycle to ease the transport of his produce. However limited capital is still a challenge.

Kenneth will use his loan to buy maize for resale.

loans.use: to purchase maize for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 21 años de edad y vivir en zona de lato riesgo,se dedica a la venta de pupusas, almuerzos y desayunos, su negocio está ubicado en su casa en una zona muy transitada por esa razón posee mucha clientela, viven casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, la joven está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz, quesillo, chicharrón, carne, pollo, arroz, verduras y  todo lo necesario para preparar los alimentos y asi continuar con sus ventas y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The young woman, whose face has been concealed because she lives in a high-risk area, is 21 and sells pupusas (Salvadoran grilled stuffed tortillas), lunches and breakfasts.  Her business is located in her home in a very busy area, and for that reason she has a considerable clientele. She lives with her husband and son in their own home.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy corn, soft cheese, roast pork, meat, chicken, vegetables and everything necessary to prepare the food. This way she can continue with her sales and have better income.

loans.use: To buy corn, soft cheese, fried pork, meat, chicken, rice, vegetables and everything necessary to make her food.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina works hard to support her family. Gina is married and has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines.

Gina requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers.

Gina has been in this business for 15 years now.

Gina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Deocita

texts.en:
Deocita is married and has five children. She works hard to support her family. She operates a fish vending business in the Philippines. Deocita earns additional income from raising pigs. 

Deocita requested her eleventh loan from NWTF for 18,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional materials such as fish containers, fishing net, etc. for her business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials such as fish containers, fishing net, etc.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is 41 years old and married. She has been running a school in her community for nine years. Zahida has been working hard to expand her business so that she can earn enough to provide better facilities for the 144 students in her school. Educating girls is something she is passionate about, and almost two-thirds of her students are girls. 

Zahida requested a loan for 100,000 PKR, which she will use to buy chairs for her students and computers for senior students and to do needed repair work around the school. This loan will ensure that her students are learning in the best environment she can provide.

loans.use: to purchase chairs for her students and buy computers for senior students and to do needed repair work around the school.

loans.name: Bibha

texts.en:
Bibha hails from Maynaguri. She is a resident of Khagrabari, a remote village in Jalpaiguri district, West Bengal. The people of this region are socially, economically, and educationally more backward in comparison to others. Bibha is 48 years old. She is a married woman with three sons. Two of them are in college, and the other is a green grocer. Her husband, 54-year-old Ramnath, is a vegetable cultivator. 

The primary work of the family is farming, from which they get a low return, which makes it very difficult to maintain the family. So, she thought about an additional source of income and started a milk business to earn some extra income. 

Therefore, she has sought a loan from Kiva's field partner BJS, about whom she heard that they support rural needy women with loans to start businesses. With this loan, Bibha will purchase a cow to start her milk business. She wants to sell the milk to her neighbors, who will be her main clients. She is very hopeful that this investment will support her to earn some extra income and help her to save money for better education of her sons and strengthen her family economy.

She is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow and start a milk selling business.

loans.name: Novie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Novie works hard to support her family.

She has a dry goods selling business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Novie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of dry goods, such as slippers, shoes, dresses, etc., to sell for her dry goods business.

Novie has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of dry goods, such as slippers, shoes, dresses, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor tiene 41 años de edad, esta casado, y tiene dos hijos con su esposa, reside en una aldea cerca del municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Víctor trabajo por varios años realizando trabajos de jornal y hace 8 años decidió tener su propio negocio para obtener ingresos y sostener a su familia. Junto a su esposa vende productos de la canasta básica familiar en una pulpería, vende arroz, azúcar, sal, café, manteca, jabón, condimentos, productos de aseo, productos enlatados, pan, refrescos, churros y otros abarrotes de consumo básico. Ya invirtió dos prestamos anteriores en su negocio y actualmente solicita otro por 22,000 Lempiras, con el fin de comprar los productos que necesita para la venta como ser harina, manteca, arroz, maíz, frijoles, azúcar, refrescos, pan, huevos, churros y otros para poder aumentar las ventas y los clientes. Su plan es crecer como microempresario y darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Victor is 41 years old. He is married and has two children with his wife. They live in a small village close to Azacualpa municipality, in Santa Bárbara. 

Victor worked as a day laborer for a number of years, and then 8 years ago decided to set up his own business to earn a living and support his family. Together with his wife, they sell basic household products in their small store. They sell rice, sugar, salt, coffee, lard, ham, condiments, cleaning products, dairy products, bread, soft drinks, chips and other common food items. 

They have already invested two earlier loans in their business and are currently requesting another loan of 22,000 Lempiras to buy the products they need for the store such as flour, lard, rice, corn, beans, sugar, soft drinks, bread, eggs, and chips, among others, to increase their sales and number of clients. Victor's plan is to continue growing the microbusiness to give the best to his family.

loans.use: to buy products such as flour, lard, rice, corn, beans, sugar, soft drinks, bread, eggs, and chips to sell in his store.

loans.name: Sana

texts.en:
Sana is 27 years old and married. She has been in business with her beauty parlor for about 5 years. 

Sana offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. By providing the best services, she has become very famous on her street. 

In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, Sana is interested in buying a greater variety of cosmetics products for her parlor. She needs a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy large quantities of hair and skin care products and bleaching and whitening creams so she can cater to more customers. 

Sana is positive about her future earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of hair and skin care products and bleaching and whitening creams in order to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Nieta Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe Nieta est constitué de quatre femmes  tous mariées et vie majoritairement  dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 35 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Lafiabougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et  leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font du commerce,  tel que la vente de, chaussures de meilleures qualités.  Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de rejoindre  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  prêt en prêt solidaire.
Madame Nièba (femme  assise  à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des chaussures à Lafiabougou. Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 18 paires de chaussures. Elles s’approvisionnent  à Bamako. La revente s’effectue à  Lafiabougou au comptant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Nièba compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour satisfaire les petits besoins de ses enfants et investir le reste dans ses activités. Madame compte beaucoup sur le partenariat  de Soro Yiriwaso pour l’atteinte de ses objectifs qui est l’élargissement de son activité.
texts.en: The Nieta group is made up of four women who are all married and who, for the most part, live in polygamous households.  On average, they are 35 years old and have three children. They all live in Lafiabougou, one of the neighborhoods of Bamako. They know one another through neighborhood tontines (investment funds for raising capital) and their for-profit businesses. The members of the group run businesses, such as the sale of the high-quality shoes. With the goal of increasing their business funds, the members of the group decided to join Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third group loan. Ms. Nièba  (the woman seated to the far left of the photo) is well known in the sale of shoes in Lafiabougou. She expects to use this loan to buy 18 pairs of shoes. She stocks up in Bamako. The resale takes place in Lafiabougou  for cash to a clientele made up mostly of women. With this loan, Ms. Nièba expects to make an average monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA, which will be used in part to meet the small needs of her children with the rest to be reinvested in her business. She is counting a lot on this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso to reach her goals of increasing her business.

loans.use: to purchase shoes

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Эльмира  успешно выплатила предыдущий кредит. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем инвесторам, помогшим ей с финансированием. На сегодняшний день а хозяйстве Эльмиры есть 3 теленка и 3 коровы.  На участке мерою 1,50 ГА она выращивает кукурузу. Она является лидером группы "БАК", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека, всего их трое. Эльмира  обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 95,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует направить на постройку дома с сараем за селом.
