texts.en: Elmira successfully repaid her last loan. She is grateful to the Kiva Fund and all of the investors, who had helped her with the financing. Today Elmira's business contains 3 calves and 3 cows. She also grows corn on 1.50 hectares of land. She is the leader of the "BAK" group that consists of two more persons, with three of them all together. Elmira requested a loan in the amount of 95,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy calves in order to increase livestock headcount. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into building a house with a barn outside the village.

loans.use: to buy calves for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Serapio

texts.es: Don Serapio es originario de la comarca El Bramadero Teustepe, con el préstamo que obtuvo anteriormente con KIVA-MICREDITO le ayudo para comprar refrescante para su siembra. En este nuevo ciclo de cosecha don Serapio requiere de un segundo préstamo para comprar 5 litros de gramoxon y 8 kilogramos de mancosec. Este crédito le ayudara a obtener una mejor producción y obtener mayores ingresos para su familia. Don Serapio quiere seguir sembrando para lograr así seguir manteniendo a su familia.
texts.en:
Serapio's from the El Bramadero Teustepe region.  His previous microcredit loan from Kiva helped him buy refreshers for his crop.

Serapio needs a second loan for this new harvest cycle to buy 5 liters of Gramoxon [herbicide] and 8 kilograms of Mancozeb [pesticide].  This loan will help him get a better crop and earn more income for his family.

Serapio wants to keep on farming to support his family.

loans.use: to buy 5 liters of Gramoxon and 8 kilograms of Mancozeb

loans.name: Walter Gabriel

texts.es:
Walter es un joven soltero y emprendedor, trabaja como ayudante de albañil en su ciudad natal, Sayan. Debido a las dificultades económicas que ha pasado en su hogar no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, por ello desde muy joven tuvo que salir a buscar trabajo para apoyar a su familia. Es una persona muy emprendedora, a pesar de los problemas siempre sale adelante y afronta todo con gran entusiasmo.
Walter tiene muchos deseos de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, por ello utilizará el crédito para comprar una refrigeradora para que de esta manera sus comidas se mantengan en mejor estado y por más tiempo. Él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, quiere que ellos sepan que esto hará que su familia salga adelante y él seguirá luchando para más adelante poder empezar a estudiar una profesión.
texts.en:
Walter's an enterprising single man.  He works as a construction assistant in his home town, Sayan.  He wasn't able to study to be a professional because of financial difficulties he went through at home.  When he was very young he had to go out and look for work to support his family.  He's a very enterprising person.  In spite of his problems, he always gets ahead and tackles everything with great enthusiasm.

Walter very much wants to improve his family's quality of life, so he'll use the loan to buy a refrigerator.  That way their food will stay fresher for longer.

He's very grateful to Kiva lenders for their generosity.  He wants them to know that this will make his family get ahead and that he'll keep on striving so he can study for a profession in the future.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to keep his food fresh

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru:
Саодат местная жительница района Хуросон в возрасте 46 лет. Она замужем, имеет троих сыновей. Ее муж работает мастером по ремонту холодильников. Старший сын работает в России в качестве трудового мигранта. Саодат сейчас собирается открыть новый бизнес, чтобы принести в дом дополнительный источник дохода и обеспечить себя стабильной прибыльной работой. Она планирует начать животноводческий бизнес и имеет все условия для его ведения.  За счет суммы кредита она хочет купить трех голов крупнорогатого скота и корм для них. Она знает как разводить скот, а при закупке и продаже скота ей будут помогать мужчины семьи.
Саодат верит в успех своего бизнеса и в вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Saodat is a 46-year-old local resident of the Khuroson district. She is married and has three sons. Her husband works as a refrigerator repairman. The oldest son works in Russia as a migrant worker. Saodat is currently planning on opening a new business to bring in an additional source of income home and provide herself with a stable and profitable work. She is planning to start an animal husbandry business and has all of the necessary conditions for running it. She wants to use this loan to buy three heads of cattle and feed for them. She knows how to raise livestock, and the men in the family will help her with buying and selling livestock. Saodat believes in the success of her business and your support.

loans.use: to buy three heads of cattle and feed for them in order to start her own animal husbandry business

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia is 39 years old and widowed. She lives in a small village of Akhaltsikhe district with her two children, who are provided with an orphan pension from the government institutions. Maia is unemployed, despite having a high education diploma. The family lives in poverty. 

In the region, there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living. So, Maia decided to start a clothing trading business with a loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Maia’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she doesn’t satisfy their requirements. 

She received the credit in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, the so-called Startup Program, that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  

With the loan of 1,500 GEL, she will purchase clothing at wholesale price and sell it in her community door to door. Her regular customers will be her neighbors. She plans to sell a wide assortment of well-priced clothing for men, women, and children. It is obvious that the job is hard for Maia, but she is ready to deal with the difficulties and develop her trading business gradually.

loans.use: to begin a trade in clothes in order to generate income.

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en:
Rashida is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of four. She started a business of selling bed sheets to support her husband financially in meeting their household expenses. After purchasing a great collection of bed sheets from the wholesale market, she sells to the people of her locality. She is quite popular in her community for selling good-quality material. 

Currently, Rashida has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a variety of bed sheets and covers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. 

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy a variety of bed sheets and covers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the maintenance costs and change the tires of the rickshaw.

loans.name: Haimanti

texts.en:
Haimanti is 52 years old.  She is from Maynaguri.  She is married, a housewife, and is blessed with one son. She and her husband are providing education to their son who studies in grade 11. Haimanti and her husband both are uneducated because of their parents' poverty.

Haimanti's husband Santosh, aged 60 years, is a cycle-rickshaw puller (a kind of three-wheeled transport widely used in rural West Bengal) by trade.   His lack of education denied him a decent job.  For many years, he has been transporting people to different places inside as well as outside of his village.  With the income that he earns, he helps his family with household expenses. It is going well for him because he is dedicated to his job, responsible, and transports his clients safely. Currently he wants to purchase a new rickshaw. He has a plan to hire the old one out for additional income, but he lacks the capital to fulfill his purpose.

So Haimanti asked for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to help her husband by purchasing a new cycle-rickshaw. He will continue working with the same determination and enthusiasm and will improve his family's quality of life.

Haimanti wants to use the profit to admit her son to a renowned school and save money for their secure future.

She appreciates the help of her generous lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Asolatkhon

texts.ru:
Асолатхону 27 лет. Она замужем за дехканина. У нее трое детей. Старшему ребенку 8 лет. Он ученик средней школы. Младшим детям 2 и 1 годик. Асолатхон по натуре очень добрая и отзывчивая женщина. Она всегда старается и работает во благо своей семьи. 
   Асолат около 6 лет занимается животноводством. Она очень активная и успевает справляться и с домашними делами  и с работами на скотном дворе. Сейчас у нее не большое количество скотин и Асолат хочет получить кредит и расширить поголовья скота. Она надеется, что благодаря кредиту она закупит большое количество скота и увеличит доход и поможет мужу обеспечить дом.
texts.en:
Asolatkhon is 27 years old. She is married to a dekhan farmer. They have three children. The oldest child is 8 years old and he is a secondary school student. The younger children and 2 and 1 years old. Asolatkhon is a very kind and responsive woman. She always tries and works hard for the welfare of her family.

Asolatkhon has been involved in animal husbandry for about 6 years. She is very active and able to handle household and livestock yard work. Now Asolatkhon has a small number of livestock and wants to increase her livestock headcount. She hopes that, thanks to this loan, she would be able to buy a large number of livestock, increase her income and help her husband support the household.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Ratna

texts.en:
Ratna, aged 25, is a young housewife from Dhupguri. She studied till fourth grade. Her family is comprised of her husband and one son. They live in the village Baroghoria, Jalpaiguri, West Bengal. Her son is continuing his schooling. 

Ratna's husband Bharat is associated with agricultural business. He grows vegetables and paddy rice on his farmland.  He is the only earning member of the family, so he works tirelessly on his farmland, with the active help from Ratna. Both Ratna and her husband have been involved in this activity for seven years. They have good knowledge of paddy rice cultivation and vegetable cultivation. They are currently growing rice.  

Ratna plans to boost her agricultural business, and to do so, she will have to purchase chemical fertilizers, good quality paddy seeds and fertilizers. In order to strengthen her agricultural business, she plans to improve her strategy and make use of new farming techniques.  

She has requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to expand her agriculture activity. She will utilize the loan to purchase agricultural supplies. Her ambition is to enlarge the business for which she is receiving financial support, and to acquire more farmland with the additional profit.

She appreciates her lenders' support.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies (high yield paddy rice seeds, fertilizers, manure, etc.) for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назира благополучно выплатила предыдущий кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она очень благодарна Фонду Кива и инвесторам, помогшим ей с финансированием. В настоящее время в хозяйстве Назиры есть 4 коровы, 3 теленка и 1 лошадь. Также на земельной доле мерою 3,00 ГА она по-прежнему выращивает картофель, кукурузу и подсолнечник для реализации. Назира является участником группы "БАК", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека. Назира обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 95,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят. Доходы от кредита она направит на дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Nazira successfully repaid her last loan, using it as intended. She is very grateful to the Kiva Fund and the investors, who had helped her with the financing. Presently, Nazira's business contains 4 cows, 3 calves and 1 horse. She also continues to grow potatoes, corn and sunflowers for subsequent sale on 3.00 hectares of land. Nazira is member of the "BAK" group that, besides her, consists of two more persons. Nazira requested a loan in the amount of 95,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy calves. She will use the earnings from the loan to continue developing her business.

loans.use: to buy calves in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Kulpotkan

texts.ru: Кулпоткан успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и инвесторам, помогшим ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день, в ее хозяйстве есть 5 коров, 2 лошади и 20 овец. Также на земельной доле мерою 2,00 Га, Кулпоткан выращивает картофель и кукурузу для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Кулпоткан является одним из трех участников группы "БАК". Она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 95,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец и бычков для откорма и последующей реализации. Доходы от кредита Кулпоткан направит на ремонт ее дома.
texts.en: Kulpotkan successfully repaid her last loan, using it as intended. She is grateful to the Kiva Fund and the investors, who had helped her with the financing. Today, Kulpotkan's business contains 5 cows, 2 horses and 20 sheep. She also grows potatoes and corn for household consumption and sale on 2.00 hectares of land. Kulpotkan is on of the three members of the "BAK" group. Kulpotkan requested a loan in the amount of 95,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy sheep and bulls for fattening up and subsequent resale. Kulpotkan will use the earnings from the loan to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy sheep and bulls for fattening up and subsequent resale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de altor riesgo, posee una tienda en su lugar de residencia desde hace 5 años, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la joven vive n casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de sopas,  pan, golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, huevos, etc. para poder tener mejores ganancias y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The young lady whose face has been pixelated since she is 25 years old and lives in a high-risk area, has had a store at her place of residence for 5 years. She has a lot of customers because of her good prices. With what she sells, she is able to cover some of her household expenses.

The young lady lives in her own house with her husband and her daughter. She is applying for a loan to buy soups, bread, snacks, soft drinks, basic staple foods, eggs, etc., in order to have better earnings and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soups, bread, snacks, soft drinks, basic staple foods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy cement, sand, bricks, a toilet, iron, laminated sheet metal, etc., to construct a sanitary bathroom in her home.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es: Jose tiene 31 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, su hijo y sus suegros, el  trabaja como empleado de una empresa privada, con lo que le pagan en su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda poniendo una puerta de metal y construyendo un muro en el lugar que muestra la foto pero con lo que gana  no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, por esa razón solicita un crédito para poder comprar laminas, hierro, ladrillos, cemento y pago de mano de obra, para que el su familia puedan vivir seguros y cómodos.
texts.en:
Jose is 31 years old and lives in his own house with his life partner, his son, and his in-laws. He works as an employee at a private company. With what they pay him at his job, he is able to cover some household expenses.

He wants to improve his housing, putting in a metal door and building a wall in the place shown in the photo. What he earns is not enough to do it, which is why he is applying for a loan to be able to buy metal sheets, iron, bricks, and cement, and to pay for labor costs, so that he and his family can live safely and comfortably.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, iron, bricks, and cement, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is a smallholder farmer from Nandi Hills, Kenya. The father of three has been running a two acre mixed-farm for six years. His main income sources are milk, eggs, tea, and a job salary. 

There is no period Josphat enjoys more than harvesting. However, this season comes with a set of challenges such as transportation of goods to and from the market. As a result, most farmers end up reducing their profits margins or even incurring losses while trying to reduce transport-related costs by selling to brokers. Those who sell in the locality are not advantaged either. 

Josphat is seeking a loan to purchase a carrier motorcycle that is very common in the rural areas. This is the only way he can rid himself of greedy brokers. The motorcycle will provide him with the freedom to transport his produce to further markets with fairer prices at an affordable and sustainable cost. 

The money he will save from this investment will increase his profit margin. He will use the additional income to meet his family's basic needs and pay for his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase farm tranportation

loans.name: Jose Feliciano

texts.es: Jose vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el se dedica desde hace 20 años a la agricultura (siembra maíz y frijol), comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona y posee muchos clientes, con las ventas logra salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, Jose esta solicitado un crédito para poder comprar fertilizantes, herbicidas, controles de plagas, abono, semillas, etc. y asi poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Jose lives in his own house with his wife and three children. For 20 years, he has worked in agriculture (growing corn and beans). He sells his products in the surrounding parts of the area, and he has many clients. With the sales, he has succeeded in going forward with the household expenses. Jose is requesting a loan to be able to buy fertilizers, herbicides, infestation control products, seeds, etc. Thus, he will be able to continue with his work to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, infestation control products, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
Issa is a young hard-working man. He is 35 years old and hails from the village of Rubindi in the Mbarara district. He grew up without his parents after both of them died when he was very young. He was brought up by his grandmother who also died when he was 12 years old. 

He worked in people’s farms where he looked after their banana plantations. Because of his hard work and determination, he managed to save some money, which enabled him to buy some cows. Now he is requesting a loan of to buy two more dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron, metal, tools, etc.

loans.name: Teogilda

texts.es:
Teogilda, vive con su conyuge y su menor hijo, en casa propia. Aproximadamente desde hace más de 15 años. Cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos. Su familia es muy unida. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia; ubicada en el distrito de Saña, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Teogilda se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno y venta de leche fresca, desde hace más de 10 años aproximadamente. El destino del préstamo es para la compra de alimentos de engorde para los animales ya que el buen alimento balanceado hace de que la vaca produzca más y mejor leche fresca. De esta manera poder aumemtar su producción, aumentar sus ventas, mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende obtener una mejora en su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Teogilda lives with her partner and her young son in their own house, and she has for about 15 years. She has good personal and professional references from her neighbors. Her family is very united. She lives in a community dedicated to business, agriculture, and livestock; the community is located in the district of Saña in the province of Chiclayo in the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Perú.

Teogilda has raised cattle and sold fresh milk for more than 10 years.

The loan will be used to buy food to fatten the animals, since good, balanced feed allows the cow to produce more and better fresh milk. In this way, she will be able to increase her production, increase her sales, improve her income, increase her earnings, and, in this way, improve the quality of her and her family’s life.

loans.use: to buy food to fatten the animals, since good, balanced feed allows the cow to produce more and better fresh milk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase different kinds of food materials and other items for his small grocery to be able to meet the demands of his customers.

loans.name: Lorine

texts.en:
Lorine is a hard working lady from Kisenyi in the Mbarara district.  She is 29 years old and still single.  She has a certificate in library records, but she is unemployed.  She has been struggling to pay back her aging mother who tried very hard to educate her despite being a widow. Lorine has been trying very hard to help her younger brothers access quality education by paying their school fees.

She operates a small restaurant, but it does not bring enough returns to pay for her siblings' school fees.

To support herself and achieve her dreams, she has approached us for a loan of 2,200,000 UGX to increase her working capital by buying food and utensils so that she can increase her customer base and income. 

She is hard working and focused.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, corn flour, beans, and utensils

loans.name: Medalla Milgrosa Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Medalla Milagrosa” tiene 17 integrantes, donde todas y cada una está poniendo lo mejor de sí para poder salir adelante y seguir siendo el sostén de la casa.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Angela, quien tiene una modesta peluquería que con mucho sacrificio pudo montar, y que hoy es el sosten de la familia. Comenta que se hizo de muy buena clientela y que con ello tiene los ingresos del día a día. Su meta es poder ir agradando su negocio, y a la vez ir dando fuente de trabajo a otras personas, que al igual que ella quieren salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de tintes, shampoo, enjuagues, cremas y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The “Miraculous Medal Group” has 17 members, and all and each one is putting forth her best efforts to get ahead and to continue as the sustainer of the household.

One member is Angela who has a modest beauty shop. With much sacrifice, she has created a business that, today, is the supporter of her family. She comments that she did it with very good customers. From this beauty shop comes the family's day to day income. Her goal is to be able to continue expanding her enterprise.

Angela is requesting this loan to invest in purchasing tints, shampoo, rinses, creams, and other beauty supplies, so she can continue to work as she has in the past.

loans.use: to buy hair dye, shampoo, rinses, creams, and other beauty shop supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for fertilizing his cacao plants.

loans.name: Wackline

texts.en:
Wackline is a hard working lady from Ibaare, Nyakayojo, Mbarara district. She is 28 years old and is happily married to a gentleman. They are blessed with one kid.  She is a grade five teacher who has been struggling to get recruited in a government school. 

Fresh from the University and having a great desire to help uplift the education standards in her community, she decided to turn her tears into joy for the very many helpless people in her society.  She requested the church to lend her some of its structures so as to begin a simple primary school to the service of the poor.

She began with a handful of pupils, just 20, and now she has an enrollment of 270 pupils.  The locals pay 28,000 shillings per household, irrespective of the number of pupils in the family. 

With the overwhelming demands of the school on her shoulders, she is baffled with the many needs for her growing institution, which include the need to construct a toilet for girls and more classrooms for P.5 and P.6 who currently study in a miserable shelter.

To get some relief from that entire burden, she approached Ugafode for some financial assistance, requesting a loan of UGX 1,500,000 with which she will top up to construct a toilet for the school. She is hardworking and resilient.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for the school

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Yeredeme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Yeredeme est composé majoritairement de femmes  polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 36 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes au Badialan III l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits, de mèches, de pommes de terre et des grains de céréales. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Oumou  (femme assise au milieu devant sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des habits (pagnes wax…) de toutes sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 35 pièces de pagnes wax  en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails au Badialan III à une clientèle mixte. Madame Oumou  espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 125 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Yeredeme group is composed mainly of polygamous women who average 36 years of age and two children. They all live in Badialan III, a district of Bamako, and they know one another as neighbors. Their small trade activities include clothing, hair extensions, potatoes and cereals.   

To bolster their working capital, the group members joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. This is their 3rd group loan cycle.

Mrs. Oumou (sitting at the center in the group photo) is a leading reseller of clothing (wax pagnes). She will use her loan to buy 35 units of wax pagnes wholesale in Bamako. She retails her stock in Badialan III to a mixed clientele. 

With this loan, Mrs. Oumou expects to earn an average monthly profit of 125,000 FCFA, which she will use to reinvest in her activity. 

With the help of Soro Yiriwaso, her goal is to purchase some land to live on.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Marie Agnes

texts.en: Marie Agnes is 24 years old. She is married with two children ages 2 and 4 years.  They are not yet in school. She has a shop and has been doing this business for four years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more rice and maize flour to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy more rice and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon, age 32, is married with two children ages 10 months and 4 years. He has a shop and has been doing this business for seven years. After getting his loan, he would like to buy more rice, sugar and soaps to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and to buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, and soaps to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, floor tiles, etc. to finish tiling the floor of her home.

loans.name: Floridelma

texts.es: Floridelma tiene 38 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de agua de coco, desde hace 5 años, su negocio esta ubicado a la orilla de la carretera en zona de mucho tránsito vehicular por esa razón posee muchos clientes,  ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de cocos por mayor para continuar con sus ventas ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi poder obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Floridelma is 38 years old and lives in her own home with her family. She has made a living by selling coconut water for the past 5 years. Her business is located at the side of a highway in an area with a lot of vehicle traffic, so she has many customers.

She requests a loan to purchase coconuts in bulk so that she can continue with her sales. This is her only source of income and she will be able to earn more money this way.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts in bulk.

loans.name: Luz Mely

texts.es:
Luz Mely tiene 37 años de edad, es soltera, conocida en el medio, por realizar la labor de crianza de animales menores (patos, cuyes, conejos, entre otros). Vive en casa propia con sus padreas, ella cuenta con buenas referencias personales y labores. Vive en una comunidad habitada por gente amable y respetuosa, que se dedicadan a la agricultura, comercio y ganaderia. Comunidad con clima caluroso y está ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Luz Mely se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores tales como patos, cuyes, pollos,etc., desde hace 02 años aproximadamente. Ella necesita préstamo para invertir en compra de animales y comida balanceada de engorde para estos, los cuales le generaran mayor venta y mejores ingresos, lo que también a su vez le permitirá obtener mayores ganancias y por ende podrá lograr una mejora en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz Mely is 37 years old, is single, and well-known in the area for her work raising small animals (ducks, guinea pigs, rabbits, etc.). She lives in her own home with her parents and has good personal and work references. She lives in a community inhabited by friendly and respectful people who work in agriculture, commerce, and ranching. It has a hot climate and is located in the Cayalti district in the Chiclayo province, part of the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast.

Luz Mely has raised small animals like ducks, guinea pigs, chickens, etc. for about the past two years. She needs a loan to invest in the purchase of animals and balanced feed to fatten them. These will earn her more money and better income. They will also allow her to increase her profits so that she can improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of animals and balanced food to fatten them.

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Benkan vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 31 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Pelengana sud de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce de poupée, de condiment, de chaussure et de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  1er cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Fantagnini (la 1ere  femme debout  de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de poupée pour enfant  dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter quelques douzaines de poupées à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Fantagnini espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 30 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The five members of the Benkan group are women who all live in nuclear families. They average 31 years of age and three children. They live in the district of southern Pelengana, in Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They know one another as neighbors, through ties of marriage and kinship, and from the income-generating activities they conduct in the area. They sell dolls, condiments, shoes, and they offer restaurant services.  

To bolster their working capital, the group members joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance program, and this is their first group loan cycle. 

Mrs. Fantagnini (standing 1st from the left in the group photo) is a leading reseller of children’s dolls in her neighborhood and adjacent districts. She plans 
to use her loan to buy a few dozen dolls in Ségou. She sells her merchandise from her home to a mixed clientele, cash or credit.  

Mrs. Fantagnini hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA, which she will use to support a portion of her children’s needs and to bolster her capital. She hopes to continue her partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy children's dolls.

loans.name: Dembagnouman Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Dembagnouman vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 55 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village Siguila de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de  restauration et de condiment. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  6eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Kadiatou (la 2eme  femme debout  de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de galette à base de sauce dans le village et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs de grains de riz  à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit au marché et à la maison à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Kadiatou  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 12 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petites dépenses familiales  et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en: The four women of the Dembagnouman group all live in traditional families. On average, they are 55 years old and have four children. They all live in the village of Siguila of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through neighborhood, parental, marriage and revenue-generating village business ties. They run small businesses making food and sauces. With the goal of increasing their business funds, the group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their sixth group loan cycle. Ms. Kadiatou (the second woman standing from the left to the right in the photo) is a major saleswoman selling buckwheat pancakes made from sauce in the village and its surroundings. She expects to use this loan to buy 2 bags of grains of rice in Ségou. The sales are made for cash and often for credit at the market and from home to a mixed clientele. Ms. Kadiatou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 12,000 francs CFA with this loan, which will be used for small family expenses and to also increase her business funds. She wishes to continue the collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to purchase grains of rice.

loans.name: Bubangizi Tubebamwe Group

texts.en:
Jadress, who is 49 years old, is a new client of UGAFODE Microfinance Limited, Ishaka Branch, and a member of the Bubangizi Tubebamwe Group. She is married with 4 children, and all of them attend school at the moment. She also has 2 grandchildren staying with her, and they attend school.

Jadress raises chicken and cattle, and her clients are all kinds of people from the nearby areas. She does agriculture from her local area of residence in Bubangizi, Kashenshero, Mitooma District. She also has a forest with trees ready for sale, where she earns income to support her family. She has requested a loan of UGX 500,000 (five hundred thousand shillings only) to buy chicks for selling.

Jadress started her businesses in 1980 to have a steady source of income with which to look after her family. She is a hardworking woman, giving her businesses 10 hours a day and 7 days a week. She is, however, limited by a shortage of capital but hopes to do well after getting the financial boost of the loan money. She hopes to grow her business and become financially stable in the next five years.

The sixth person in the photo is a member of the group who is not taking a loan this cycle but is saving; she also signed the client waiver.

loans.use: to buy young chicks

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 32 years old. She is married with four children aged between one and 12 years, two of them go to school. She sells clothes and has been selling for 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more shirts, t-shirts and shorts to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more shirts, t-shirts and shorts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Claisilia

texts.en: This loan helps Claisilia get connected to her local prepay microgrid. Claisilia is a 46-year-old mother of three. All of her children go to school. She runs a small business and lives in a small white and blue wooden house in Les Anglais, in southern Haiti. She is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to be able to connect to the local solar-powered microgrid, and to get reliable electricity at home. After running pilots since 2012 that proved the benefits of prepay quality electricity to people in Les Anglais (first with 14 households, and up to 54), EarthSpark International is developing a full-scale, solar-powered microgrid. This microgrid is expected to meet the needs of up to 500 households. Kiva loans allow EarthSpark to increase the number of beneficiaries by reducing the up-front costs for customers, and will be repaid over time by electricity sales. To see a video of Les Anglais and the hybrid solar grid, please click here.

loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Emerance

texts.en: Emerance is 42 years old. She is married with 3 children who are 2 and 8 years old. Both of them go to school. She has a mini market and has been running this business for 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bread, milk and juice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more bread, milk and juice to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 20-year-old university student majoring in Remnants Protection Science, and she is in her third year. Sarah lives with her family that consists of three members in Salt-Jordan. 

She is seeking to get her Bachelor's so that she can improve her studies and start her Master's journey. Now she is applying for this loan to be able to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Viviane

texts.en: Viviane is 53 years old. She is married with 4 children who are between 13 and 23 years old; all of them go to school. She sells charcoal and has been in this business for 10 years. After getting her loan, she would like to buy more charcoal to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Khosiyatkhon

texts.ru: Хосиятхон 41 год. Она является матерью четверых детей. Ее муж работает вдали от семьи, он трудовой мигрант России. Сама Хосиятхон профессиональная швея. Она в течение более 10 лет предоставляет услуги швеи у себя дома в городе Турсунзаде. Хосиятхон шьет национальные одеяния для женщин, ее услуга всегда востребована. На протяжении долгих лет Хосиятхон шила на своей старой машинке и теперь хочет обновить его для расширения дела. Для этой цели Хосиятхон берет кредит. Она собирается приобрести модернизированную компьютерную швейную машинку. Лишь с вашей поддержкой Хосиятхон сможет осуществить свои планы.
texts.en: Khosiyatkhon is 41 and the mother of four children. Her husband works far away from the family as a migrant worker in Russia. Khosiyatkhon is a professional seamstress and has been offering sewing services from home in the city of Tursun-Zoda for over ten years. Khosiyatkhon sews traditional dresses for women and her services are always in demand. She has been sewing on her old machine for years and would now like to update it and expand her business. This is why she is taking out a loan to get a modern, computerized sewing machine. She can only carry out her plan with your help.

loans.use: to buy a computerized sewing machine

loans.name: Akolly

texts.fr: Afin d'acheter des boissons,mr Akolly sollicite de WAGES un second crédit. Il a démarré en 2003 et s'approvisionne à Lomé. Il espère réinjecter les profits supplémentaires dans l'activité et assurer au mieux aux besoins de la famille(âgé de 39ans, il est marié).
texts.en:
Mr. Akolly is seeking a second loan from WAGES to purchase beverages. 

He launched his activity in 2003, and he buys his stock in Lomé. He plans to reinvest his extra profits in his business and do his utmost to meet the needs of his family. 

Mr. Akolly is a 39-year-old married man.

loans.use: to buy beverages to sell.

loans.name: Jaime Hugo

texts.es:
Jaime es un padre de familia que siempre hace todo por su familia, para poder sacarlos adelante, es por ellos que lucha día a día y actualmente está laborando como maestro de Obra en sus ciudad natal, Ancash. En sus tiempos libres le gusta pasarlo con su familia, ir a caminar o conversar sobre cómo les fue durante el día, él dice que esos pequeños especiales son los que siempre se quedará grabado en sus seres queridos.
Jaime está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá cubrir los gastos de educación de sus hijos, como pago de la Academia porque uno de ellos se está preparando para poder postular a la Universidad, con esto él podrá cumplir su sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en grandes profesionales y así poco a poco seguir mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Jaime is a father who has always done everything that he can to help his family to get ahead. He fights every day for his family. Jaime currently works as a labourer in his native city of Ancash. Jaime likes to spend his free time with his family, walking or chatting with them about their day. Jaime says that these small but special moments will forever remain with his loved ones.

Jaime is very grateful to Kiva lenders as, thanks to their support, he will be able to cover the costs of his children's education. He will be able to pay the cost of classes for one of his son's to take pre-university courses. This loan will allow Jaime to achieve his dream of seeing one of his children become a great professional and, little by little, Jaime can improve his family's quality of life..

loans.use: to pay for his son's pre-university courses.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Esperanza está en su ciclo número 6 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas tienen la esperanza de poder mejorar sus vidas a través del trabajo unido de todas y con las capacitaciones que la fundación les va dando.
Una persona que se destaca por su esfuerzo es la Sra. Ayelen quien se dedica a la Venta de artículos de mercería, tiene todo tipo de productos, y por medio de su trabajo se gana la vida dignamente. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y muy emprendedora, que quiere salir adelante, y ayuda a su familia por medio de su trabajo.
La Sra. Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de ropas, accesorios, productos de librerías entre otras cosas, para poder seguir con sus ventas, e ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The La Esperanza group is on its 6th loan cycle in the women's committee program, where all the women have the hope of improving their lives by working together and growing their skills in the foundation's programs.

One person who stands out for her efforts is Ayelen, who has a general store where she sells all kinds of products. Through this job she earns a dignified living. She is a very hard-working woman and entrepreneurial; she wants to be successful and help her family through her work.

She seeks a loan to buy clothing, accessories, and office supplies among other items to be able to continue with her sales thus improving her living condition and income.

loans.use: to buy clothing, accessories, office supplies and other items.

loans.name: Barpygul

texts.ru: Барпыгул, 59 лет, вдова, многодетная мать 4 детей, все дети взрослый и самостоятельные, по хозяйству Барпыгул помогают ее родственники. У Барпыгул высшее педагогическое образование, много лет она проработала учителем кыргызского языка и литературы, сейчас она на заслуженной пенсии. Сельским хозяйством Барпыгул занимается уже очень давно, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве есть 1 дойная корова, 2 теленка и 10 овец. Также на участке мерою 2,58 ГА, она выращивает клевер и фасоль для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации.  Несмотря на то, что Барпыгул занимается различной деятельностью и берется за любую работу, ее ежемесячных доходов не хватает на достойную жизнь. Поэтому в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 дойной коровы и 2 бычков для разведения, также Барпыгул планирует потратить часть кредита на покупку корма для скота. Доходы от кредита позволят Барпыгул улучшить ее материальное состояние и расширить площадь орошаемых земель.
texts.en: Barpygul is 59 years old, a widow and a mother of 4 children, all of whom are grown and independent. Barpygul's relatives help her with the household. Barpygul has a higher pedagogical education and had worked as a Kyrgyz language and literature teacher for many years and is now on a well-deserved retirement. Barpygul has been involved in agriculture for a long time and currently has 1 dairy cow, 2 calves and 10 sheep. She also grows clover and beans for household consumption and sale on a 2.58 hectare land plot. Despite the fact that Barpygul is involved in various businesses and takes on any type of work, her monthly earnings are not enough for a decent life. This is why, in order to further develop her business, Barpygul requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy 1 dairy cow and 2 bulls for fattening up and also to buy livestock feed. The earnings from the loan will allow Barpygul to improve her financial condition and expand the area of irrigated land.

loans.use: to buy 1 dairy cow and 2 bulls for fattening up and also to buy livestock feed

loans.name: María Francisca

texts.es:
María de 65 años de edad,  solo tubo la oportunidad de estudiar segundo grado se caso y es madre de  hijos de los cuales los 2 primeros ya tienen familia aparte su esposo falleció hace muchos años.

 María  afirma que desde que su esposo falleció, ella ha velado por darles lo mejor a sus hijos ahora solo 2 viven con ella un varón y una hembra, también 2 nietos que ella se encarga de cuidar que  estudian una 6 grado y otra 8 grado, ella siempre se ha dedicado a trabajar en una cooperativa en la corta y abona del cultivo del café.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar lamina, clavos, madera para repara su casa. El sueño de María es en un futuro mejorar su vivienda aun mas, para que su familia se sienta mas segura y cómoda.
texts.en:
María is 65 years old and completed second grade in school. She is married and has children, the two oldest have their own families. Her husband died several years ago. María shares that since her husband died she has made sure to provide the best for her children. Now only a son and daughter live with her. She also has two grandchildren that she takes care of and they are in 6th and 8th grades. She has always worked in a cooperative harvesting and fertilizing coffee plants.

The loan she seeks will be used to buy laminate, nails, and wood to repair her home. Her dream is to improve her home so that her family will feel secure and comfortable.

loans.use: to buy laminate, nails, and wood to repair her home.

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Sabali vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village Douga-wêrê de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de condiment et de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  12eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Sanata   (la 2eme  femme debout  de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de galette à base de sauce dans le village et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 sacs de riz  à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit au marché et à la maison à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Sanata espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 25 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petites dépenses familiales  et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The five members of the Sabali group are women who all live in traditional families. They average 42 years of age and four children. They live in the village of Douga-wêrê in Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They know one another as neighbors, through ties of marriage and kinship, and from the income-generating activities they conduct in the area. They sell condiments, and they offer restaurant services. 

To bolster their working capital, the group members joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance program, and this is their 12th group loan cycle. 

Mrs. Sanata (standing 2nd from the right in the group photo) is a leading seller of rice cakes with gravy in her neighborhood and adjacent districts. She plans to use her loan to buy three sacks of rice in Ségou. She sells her products from her home and at the market, to a mixed clientele, cash or credit. 

Mrs. Sanata hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 25,000 FCFA, which she will use to support a portion of the household expenses and to bolster her capital. She hopes to continue her partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy rice.

loans.name: William Donald

texts.es:
William Donald tien 38 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente, tiene un hijo menor de de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su conyugue e hijo vivienda construida de material rustico (adobe y techo de teja). La vida en el lugar es tranquila, sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería. El lugar donde vive es un caserio de aproximadamente 50 familias dicho caserio tiene aproximadamente 45 años de creación política y está ubicado en el distrito de Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza William Donald es la venta de carne de porcino. Para ello compra dichos animales en la zona, los engorda y sacrifica para vender la carne al menudeo en la zona y también recorre por las zonas aledañas en su moto. La actividad la realiza desde hace 4 años, en la parte posterior de su vivienda ahí tiene sus corrales para la crianza, y en la misma vivienda sacrifica y vende la carne a los pobladores de la zona.

El destino del crédito es para compra de un lote de animales de raza mejorada. Y también será para mejorar sus corrales ya que por la compra de los animales necesita tener corrales más amplios y seguros. La inversión le ayudará incrementar las ventas y a obtener mayores ingresos para su familia ya que al mejorar la raza porcina obtiene mayor producción de carne. El mercado presenta buenas perspectivas debido a que el negocio en la zona no hay competencia en este rubro. William Donald piensa seguir invirtiendo en su negocio ya que año tras año su negocio viene siendo más conocido en la zona y caseríos aledaños, así mismo sus ventas vienen creciendo. Y de esta manera obtener mejores ganancias que le permitan a un mediano o corto plazo aumentar sus ingresos y en corto plazo emjroar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
William Donald is 38 years old, married, and has a young son. He lives in his own home with his wife and son. The home is made of rustic materials (adobe and straw roof). It is tranquil to live here; his neighbors are grow crops and raise animals. There are approximately 50 families who live in this area in the Santo Tomas district, Cutervo province, Cajamarca region, in northern Peru.

William David works selling pork. He buys animals in the area, fattens them, and then sells them for meat.in his immediate areas as well as neighboring areas. He has been in this business for 4 years, and has his animal corrals behind his home. He also butchers and sells meat to those who live in his area.

The loan is to buy a group of high-quality animals. He will also use it to improve his corrals because if he buys animals he needs bigger and more secure corrals. The loan will help him increase sales and obtain greater earnings for his family because by improving the quality of his pig he will have a greater production of meat. The market has good prospects thanks to the business in this region as there is no competition in this field.

William Donald plans to continue investing in his business because year after year his business is becoming more known in the village and neighboring villages. Thus his sales are increasing. In this way he will obtain greater profits which will give him a way to increase his earnings and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animals and improve his corrals.

location.town: Santo Domingo de la Capilla - Cutervo - Cajamarca

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Echana

texts.en:
Echana is a 43-year-old woman married to a farmer in Boragari village in the district of Jalpaiguri, West Bengal, India. Her husband, 55-year-old Abdul, is engaged in cultivation of paddy in their village. The couple has four children (two sons and two daughters). Three of them are in school, and their eldest son helps his father in agriculture. Both Echana and her husband have a primary education. They live in their own straw, bamboo and mud-made house.

Echana is a homemaker who takes care of the entire household. In order to help with all the family expenses, her husband and son have been involved in doing vegetable cultivation, such as potatoes and other green vegetables. Of late, they have started paddy cultivation and selling it to the distributors. They supply their rice to the rice dealers in the nearby market. Being an all-season crop, paddy is in great demand in the market. They think it to be a prospective crop, so they want to cultivate paddy on a large scale.

In order to strengthen their business and respond to client demand, Echana is requesting a loan for her husband from BJS (Kiva's field partner) to purchase fertilizers, pesticides and seeds, and to cover their operational costs. Their goal is to increase their business activity, which they think will be possible through this loan.

Echana dreams to purchase a piece of land with the profit, and she expresses her gratitude to her lenders.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies for her husband's paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Nurbubu

texts.ru: Нурбубу 52 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитала 4 детей. У Нурбубу среднее образование. Она известна как принципиальный, честный и добросердечный человек. Нурбубу с 1992 года в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, начала свой бизнес по увеличению поголовья скота в своем хозяйстве, а также в полеводстве. В хозяйстве у Нурбубу имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 4 теленка и 15 овец и земельный надел мерою 2,1 ГА, где она выращивает фасоль и клевер. Доходы от бизнеса Нурбубу вкладывает в увеличение поголовья скота в своем хозяйстве. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку двух дойных коров. Доходы от кредита Нурбубу планирует использовать для увеличения поголовья скота, а также намерена накопить средства на свадьбу сына.
texts.en:
Nurbubu is 52 years old, married and has raised four children together with her husband. Nurbubu has secondary education. She is known as a principled, honest and good-hearted person. 

In pursuit of a source of income for her family, Nurbubu started her business of livestock breeding and field crop cultivation in 1992. Nurbubu has two dairy cows, four calves and 15 sheep on her farm, and a plot of land of 2.1 hectares of land, where she grows haricots and clover. Nurbubu invests the income from the business in increasing the number of livestock on her farm. 

To further develop her business, she turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase two dairy cows. Nurbubu plans to invest the income from the loan in increasing the number of livestock, and she also intends to save money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase two dairy cows

loans.name: Rahat

texts.ru: Рахат 53 года, не замужем, есть 1 сын, который с радостью помогает матери. У Рахат средне-специальное образование, она учитель начальных классов, много лет проработала по специальности. Однако в 2001 году решила открыть свой бизнес, которым и занимается до сих пор. Рахат имеет собственную торговую точку, где продает галантерейные товары. Благодаря упорному труду Рахат на сегодняшний день у нее есть товар на сумму 80,000 сом (KGS). Ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет всего около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Рахат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку пряжи и стелек для обуви, Рахат считает, что в зимний период этот вид товаров будет пользоваться большим спросом. Рахат планирует расширить ее бизнес и накопить средства на образование ее сына.
texts.en:
Rahat is 53 years old and not married. She has one son, who gladly helps his mother. Rahat has vocational education. She is a primary school teacher, and has worked in her profession for many years. 

However, in 2001 Rahat decided to start her own business, which she has continued to this day. She has her own point of sales, where she sells haberdashery. Thanks to Rahat's persistent work, she currently has goods in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS). Her monthly income is around 10,000 som (KGS) per month in total. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Rahat turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase yarn and insoles for shoes. Rahat reckons that in this type of goods will be in high demand in the winter period. Rahat plans to expand her business and save money for her son's education.

loans.use: to purchase yarn and insoles for shoes for selling, to be more competitive and pay for her son's education

loans.name: Mavlyudahan

texts.ru: Мавлюдахан 46 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Мавлюдахан - среднее образование, с 1986 года в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Мавлюдахан на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 2 теленка и 10 овец. Также есть 0,76 ГА собственной земли, где Мавлюдахан и ее семья выращивают рис для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации, ежегодно Мавлюдахан продает 3 - 4 тоны риса. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 18,000 сом (KGS). В целях увеличения своего бизнеса Мавлюдахан обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 90,000 сом (KGS) на покупку сена для скота, это позволит сохранить скот и весной получить здоровый приплод. Доходы от кредита Мавлюдахан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Mavlyudahan is 46 years old, married and raising five children together with her husband. Mavlyudahan has secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, she has worked with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation since 1986. 

Thanks to persistent work, Mavlyudahan's farm currently has two cows, two calves and 10 sheep. She also has 0.76 hectares of own land, on which she and her family grow rice for internal use and for sale. Every year, Mavlyudahan sells 3-4 tons of rice. Her monthly income is around 18,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Mavlyudahan turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 90,000 som (KGS) to purchase hay for the livestock. This will allow her to keep the cattle and have healthy offspring in the spring. Mavlyudahan plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase hay as fodder for her livestock

loans.name: Santa Barbara Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina SANTA BARBARA  integrado por 17 mujeres, se encuentran en el quinto ciclo, estas señoras caracterizan por ser mujeres independientes, que con trabajo duro y esfuerzo van progresando cada día más.
La Sra. Maria, integrante y presidenta de dicho comité, se caracteriza por su emprendedurismo, cuenta con una despencita en su propia casa donde ofrece productos de la canasta familiar con lo que genera ingresos diarios y le posibilita llevar una vida digna. 
Así como la Sra. Maria, sus compañeras agradecen a la fundación paraguaya por la confianza en bríndales esta oportunidad y por las capacitaciones, manifiestan que a través de ello sus inversiones les resulta muy beneficiosa.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para su despensa como ser verduras, frutas, carne, enlatados, y demás.
texts.en:
The communal bank called "SANTA BARBARA" is made up of 17 women who are entering their 5th loan cycle. They are independent women who work hard and make an effort to keep progressing every day.

Maria is one member and the President of the group. She is known for her entrepreneurship. She has a small store in her house where she offers basic food items. With the revenue she generates each day she can lead a dignified life.

Maria and her companions are grateful to the Fundación Paraguaya for the confidence they show giving this opportunity and for their training. They feel that because of them their investments will be very beneficial.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy a variety of supplies for her store like vegetables, fruit, meat, canned goods, etc.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, meat, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Villa Conavi Group

texts.es:
Este comité lleva por nombre Villa Conavi, debido al lugar  donde ellas viven. Está integrada por 19 mujeres emprendedoras y muy trabajadoras, pasaron ya al cuarto ciclo gracias a la responsabilidad del grupo.
Sus actividades se basan más bien en la cría y engorde de animales, entre las cuales se puede mencionar a la Sra. Mirian quien encabeza este comité, ella cría cerdos en cantidad considerable y los faena para su comercialización.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de cerdos, para poder faenarlos y luego venderlos.
texts.en:
This group is called Villa Conavi, because of the place where they live. The group has 19 members, very enterprising women, who are in their fourth cycle thanks to the group's responsibility.
They mainly raise and fatten animals. Mirian is the head of the committee. She raises a considerable number of hogs and fattens them for sale.
She is requesting a loan for the purchase of hogs to raise and later sell.

loans.use: to buy pigs for sale.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa Elvira tiene 44 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo, en casa propia, en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Cayalti y goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos, dicha comunidad está ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Rosa Elvira se dedica a la actividad de crianza y venta de animales(patos, chivos, conejos, entrw otros), desde hace más de 7 años de antiguedad en el negocio, en la parte posterior de propio domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de más animales y alimento de engorde para la crianza de los mismos. Lo que le permitirá aumentar y diversificar su stock, para poder complacer todos los gustos y preferencias de su público consumidor y de esta manera hacer crecer más su negocio, obtener más ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa Elvira is 44 years old, married, and lives with her husband in a home of her own, in a large community within the Cayalti urban area.  She has good personal and professional references from her neighbors. This community is located in the Chiclyo province, within the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.  Her’s is basically an agricultural, livestock, and merchant community.

Rosa Elvira raises and sells animals (ducks, goats, rabbits, and others) and has been doing this behind her house for more than seven years.  She is asking for this loan to buy more animals and feed.  This will allow her to increase and diversify her stock so she can meet all of her customer demands and preferences, grow her business, increase her income, and be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
El  señor Eduardo tiene 39 años de edad, está casado  tiene dos  hijos, por quienes esta luchando para poder darle una mejor calidad de vida.
El señor Eduardo tiene una despensa bien surtida,tiene casa propia, donde vende todo tipo de productos. Se inició como empleado luego puso su propio negocio, que hasta hoy le va muy bien, con clientela ya bien formada por su antigüedad en el rubro.
Solicita el prestamo para capital de trabajo, para poder comprar verduras, frutas, enlatados, panificados, lácteos, carnes, y demás de manera a poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 39, married, and has two children for whom he is working very hard in order to give them a better quality of life.
Eduardo has a well-stocked store. He has his own home where he sells all kinds of products. He started off as an employee and later opened his own business. It has gone very well thus far. He has a strong client base because he has been in the business for so long.
He is requesting this loan to stock his business with vegetables, fruit, canned goods, baked goods, dairy products, meat, and more, in order to be able to keep working.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, canned goods, baked goods, dairy products, meat, and more.

loans.name: Jaya

texts.en:
Jaya is only 20 years old and has not stopped fighting for and moving forward with her dreams. She is a mother to an infant, which she considers a blessing from God.  She passed 10th standard and could not go for higher study because of her parent's poverty. She lives with her child and husband in a small village named Kamatpara in the Japaiguri district of West Bengal.

Her husband, 23-year-old Sibu, only completed primary school, but has more than five years of experience in growing paddy.  Knowledge of this has been passed down from generation to generation in his family. His customers are the various buyers that arrive in the area, and the various local stores from his area and the surrounding areas. 

At the moment, Jaya needs help to buy agricultural supplies for her husband's agribusiness and to be able to strengthen his paddy cultivation. She needs supplies such as manure, fertilizers, and insecticides among other things. With these, she can help her husband to grow his cultivation. So she asked for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).

Her plans are to increase the production of crops and to generate more income. 

Her dreams are to be able to purchase a cow with the profit. She is grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural inputs such as seeds, and fertilizers to enhance their paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials for a porch.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sand, cement, iron and bricks.

loans.name: Melqui

texts.es:
Melqui tiene 28 años de edad, su estado civil es Conviviente y tiene 2 menores hijos bajo su cargo, vive en casa propia de material noble en el distrito Morropón, el cual es un lugar donde sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio cuenta con servicios básicos como son agua y luz; y está ubicada en la provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que desarrolla Melqui es el servicio de transporte, teniendo unidad propia actividad que realiza hace 2 años, contando ya con clientela fija para ofrecer su servicio por lo que lleva materiales de costrucción, transporta platano a clientes de sus chacras entre otros y ademásse dedica también a la agricultura en el caserio del Ingenio, ingresos adicionales que le permiten sustentar el prestamo.

El destino del crédito es para mantenimiento de Motocargera(Mantenimiento de motor, cambio de llantas y mejoramiento del mismo) con la reparacion de unidad de transporte él podrá asegurar el correcto funcionamiento de su herramienta de trabajo y le ayudará a obtener mejores ingresos. El mercado presenta buenas perspectivas debido a que ha aumentado la construcciones de vivienda por la zona(transportando materiales de cosntrucción), y por cosecha de arroz transporta cargas de arroz a comerciantes de la zona, y además cliente tiene respaldo de haber sembrado frijol teniendo ingresos futuros.
texts.en:
Melqui is 28 and lives with his partner. He has 2 small children under his care and lives in his own, well-built home in the district of Morropón, an area where the residents work in agriculture, livestock, and commerce. They have basic services like water and electricity. Their home is located in the province of Morropón, Piura region, on the north coast of Peru.
Melqui provides a transportation service. He has his own vehicle and has been doing this for two years. He has a fixed clientele for whom he transports construction materials and bananas and other items. He also works in agriculture in the hamlet of Ingenio. This gives him an additional income which will allow him to repay the loan.
Melqui will use this loan to maintain his vehicle (maintain the motor, change the tires, and improve the vehicle) through repairs. He will be able to ensure that his vehicle functions properly, and this will help him to obtain a greater income. The market has good prospects because home construction has increased in the area and he transports construction materials, and because during the rice harvest he transports rice to local merchants. He also has the backup of having planted beans for future income.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle (motor maintenance, tire change, and improvements).

loans.name: Lutfa

texts.en:
Lutfa is a 26-year-old married lady and she has three kids (one son and two daughters). She is a responsible mother and lives with her kids and husband in the small village of Boragari in Jalpaiguri district. Her husband, 29-year-old Babul, is engaged in a business of selling plywood. Two of her children are in grade three and grade two and the other is too young for school. 

A few years ago, in search of an additional source of income for her family, she started working in animal husbandry. Currently, she is in the business of selling milk to her neighbors who are her main customers. Due to her hard work, she has achieved great success in her business. 

Lutfa sells good quality milk, which is in high demand among local residents. Since demand is growing, she has turned to Kiva's partner BJS for a loan.

Lutfa will use the loan to buy an additional milking cow. She plans to use the profits from the loan to further develop her business and to send her children to a good school. With the savings from her income, she wants to give good education to her children. She conveys her thanks to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her milk supply business.

loans.name: Manija

texts.en:
Twenty-one-year-old Manija hails from Dhupguri.  She went to school up to the eighth grade. She is married now and a housewife who lives with her husband and a very young daughter at Altagram in Jalpaiguri district. 

Majina's husband grows vegetables. His business and principal source of income is cultivating vegetables, which he has been doing for many years, beginning with his father who also gave him the land that he works today. This land is very close to his house and he walks there. He grows gourds, beans, potatoes etc. His plans are to improve his vegetable cultivation and start growing broad beans, which are a very useful vegetable being in much demand among the local people. For this reason, Majina is asking for financial support from BJS (Kiva's partner). With the loan, she will purchase seeds and fertilizers for her husband to cultivate broad beans, which will help contribute to the improvement of his business. She dreams of constructing a concrete-made house for them with the profit and she is very much thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers to cultivate broad beans.

loans.name: Megun

texts.en:
Megun lives with her husband and three sons in their own house in the small town of Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.  She is only 41 years old and attended school up to grade five. Her sons go to school.  Her husband Jayanta, 48 years old, who studied up to grade nine, is engaged in the firewood business.

Megun's husband runs his business of selling firewood.  He purchases firewood and sells it to the villagers, as it is used as fuel in rural areas. Now she and her husband want to expand their business. Megun has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase more firewood for her husband's business. She is a very optimistic woman and hopes to get additional profit from this to maintain her family well.

Her dreams are to provide a better education to her sons to be established in life.  She also wants to get ahead with her business for their secure future.

She gives her hearty thanks to both the lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: To purchase firewood for her business.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El comité de Mujeres San Miguel es de la ciudad de Lambaré,  inician el 5to. ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, son mujeres muy luchadoras, que se están esforzando por poder crecer y salir adelante.
Estelbina es vendedora de bebidas, comenta que se animo a este trabajo y que le va muy bien, recibe capacitaciones, y por medio de ello puede conocer la forma de manejar sus ingresos. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que tiene muchos deseos de poder superarse y salir adelante, ya que ella es el sostén de la casa y de su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de cervezas, vinos, y demás bebidas varias, ya que necesita más productos, para poder seguir con sus ventas.
Todas agradecen por esta oportunidad que reciben ya que les será de mucha ayuda en el manejo de sus pequeños emprendimientos.
texts.en:
The Women’s Committee of San Miguel is from the city of Lambare.  They are beginning their fifth cycle in the committee for women program.  They are very hardworking women who have strived to grow and get ahead.

Estelbina sells beverages and says that she got motivated to do this type of work and things are going very well for her.  She gets training, and is able to see the best way to manage her business.  She is a very hardworking woman with a great desire to succeed and get ahead because she is the breadwinner for her family. 

She is asking for this loan so she can buy beers, wines, and a variety of other beverages because she needs more products to continue making sales.

Everyone is grateful for this opportunity because it will be of great help to them in managing their small businesses.

loans.use: to buy beverages for resale.

loans.name: Nadira

texts.ru: Надира, 46 лет, не замужем, есть дочь- школьница. У Надиры среднее образование. В качестве основного источника дохода для семьи, она занимается животноводством. Начатое в много лет тому назад хозяйство на сегодня приносит прибыль около 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. На данный момент в хозяйстве Надиры имеется 6 коров и 16 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Надира обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков и овец для откорма и перепродажи. Надира является лидером группы "Эленур", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека, всего их трое.  Доходы от кредита Надира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Nadira is 46 years old, single, and she has a daughter who is still in school.  Nadira herself has a secondary education.  She is involved in animal husbandry, an activity which constitutes her family's main source of income.  Her farming business, started many years ago, now brings her an income of close to 20,000 som (KGS) per month.  Nadira currently owns six cows and 16 sheep.  In order to further develop her business, she has turned to the bank Bai Tushum and requested a loan of 100,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy some young bulls and sheep for fattening and resale.  Nadira is the leader of a group called "Elenur", which consists of two more people, so three in total.  Nadira plans to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further increasing her herd.

loans.use: to purchase young bulls and sheep in order to grow her business.

loans.name: Sarala

texts.en:
Sarala is a 30-year-old lady. She is married and lives with her husband and children (one son and one daughter) in the small town of Madhya Khagrabari in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.  She is illiterate and can only sign her name.  Her husband Binay, 34 years old, is also illiterate.  One of their children is a student in grade five and another is in grade one.  

Sarala's husband is associated with the fast food business. He is the main source of income for the family, but he is unable to give sufficient financial support to his family with his small income.
